Teofila A. is from the village of Inasagan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 62 years old. Teofila is married. To make a living, Teofila owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as sardines, pancit,sugar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Teofila is just starting this business.

In 2008, Teofila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.  Teofila is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Teofila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily use products to sell

loans.name: 06-  Kiều Đại 2- Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
"Hương Lê Thị L. (15) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Hương is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 06- Kiều Đại 2 - Đông Vệ (08.03.06 - Đông Vệ).


Hương is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Hương owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling liquor such as beer & wine in the local community.  Hương has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hương is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.248.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Hưng (16) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  T. Thị Vậy (17) is a 70 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


3.  B. Thị Hà (18) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hương Lê Thị L. (15) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06 - Kiều Đại 2- Đông Vệ (08.03.06 - Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán loại thức uống có cồn như bia & rượu trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hương kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hương đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Hưng (16) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

texts.en:
"Lợi N. Thị (36) is a 56 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Lợi is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 09-Quảng xá 3- Đông Vệ (08.07.09 Đông Vệ ).


Lợi is married and has one adult-aged child.  To making a living, Lợi owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Lợi has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Lợi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lợi is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.248.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lợi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

3.  N. Thị Loan (35) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia G. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in buying and selling goods for business. She buys and sells herbal medicines and other herbal products. She sells it to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for six years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more herbal products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nemesia from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of her family. 



About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: used to purchase more herbal products to sell

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor M. is from the village of Bongbong Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 31 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Amor owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Amor has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Amor is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second taken out by Amor from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

texts.en:
Norma B. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Norma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In July 2007, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.name: Mr. Sin Matt Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people are living in Prey Ta Khab village in Takeo province.  They are all taking a village bank loan so that they can improve their family's standard of living with their portion of the loan.  Mr. Sin M. is the village bank president who was selected by the other members.
   
He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family.  He is also a cow middleman and his wife, Mrs. Roem Nhoem, is a pig and chicken breeder.  Now he wants to buy a cow, because it is cheap.  Mr. Sin M. is applying for a loan for this purpose.  He is a father of six children, four of whom are employed in garment factories while the others are helping their parents’ businesses.  All the members is shown in this picture but two of whom are blocked.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mrs. Chorn Sarem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn S. is a village bank president who has been selected by sixteen people who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in which it will improve their family living in Prey Ta Khab village, Takeo province.

She and her husband, Mr. Nang Toem, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support their family and she is also breeding pig and chicken.  Since her breeding is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this purpose, Mrs. Chorn S. is applying for a loan to buy more piglets and chickens. 

She is a mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and chickens to expand breeding

loans.name: Mrs. Nhean Sina Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan includes 18 people in Prey Theat village, Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan for different purpose to improve their family life. Mrs. Nhean S. was selected as the village bank president by the other members. 

She is a rice seller who can earn a large profit to support her family. Her business is going well time-to-time, which she wants expand. To improve this business, Mrs. Nhean S. is seeking a loan to buy more rice to sell. Her husband, Mr. Oun Soa, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. He is a bicycle repairer, too. This couple has four children who all are students.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en: Hurelbaatar B. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in a rented fence. His two children both attend a local secondary school. Hurelbaatar operates a coal and firewood selling business in his town with the help of his sibling. They purchase the coal using their truck and sell it at the local market at retail price. He has engaged this business since 2009 after living and working as a herder in the countryside. His business earnings are the only source of his family income. Hurelbaatar is a modest man and is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase more coal and wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more coal and wood

loans.name: Leonida's Group

texts.en:
Leonida M. is from the village of Bagong Silang Centro West, Santiago. She is 43 years old. Leonida is the group leader of a eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Leonida M..

Leonida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand her manicure/pedicure service

location.town: Bagong Silang Centro West , Santiago City

loans.name: Oyunhuu

texts.en:
Oyunhuu S. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest son currently works, her middle daughter is a university student, while her youngest daughter attends a local high school. 

Oyunhuu and her husband operate a welding service business in their town.  They started their business in 2006 after operating a cafe in the local market for several years. 

Oyunhuu is a modest woman and says, " We try to work hard to provide a good and decent life for our children".   She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase welding equipment and other necessary tools and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase welding equipment, tools, and materials

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
The fifteen people who make up this village bank loan live in Prey Theat village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan to improve their family living.  They have selected Mrs. Pech H. to become the village bank president.          

Mrs. Pech H. owns a general store in the local village.  She is able to earn profit to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Sabun Meas, is a staff member in an organization.  He is also a farmer who owns a 1.50-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family.  

They try to work a lot but they earn very little income.  So to improve her family, Mrs. Pech H. is applying for a loan to buy some piglets and chickens for breeding to start a new business. She has a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets and chicken to breed and sell

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Liên N. Thị (16) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Liên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04 - Mật Sơn1 - Đông Vệ (08.02.04 - Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Liên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Liên kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Liên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Liên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

2.  B. Thị Thắm (18) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  N. Thị Thu (19) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make bamboo products

loans.name: 01- Mật Sơn 1- Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Huyền Lê Thị (01) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Huyền is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 01- Mật Sơn 1- Đông Vệ (08.09.01- Đông Vệ).


Huyền is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To making a living, Huyền owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector running a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling  to local businesses and community members.  Huyền has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huyền is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    She is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND,  which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Huyền from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị Nam (02) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  T. Thị lợi (03) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Tsedenbal

texts.en: Tsedenbal J. is 31 years old and lives with his mother in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his mother live together in their ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent.  He supports his mother and himself by operating a taxi service in his town. In addition, he purchases cars and sells them for a profit to supplement his earnings. He needs more funds to repair a car that will be sold for profit.   He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to make the necessary repairs and replace parts for his car trading business.

loans.use: To make repairs and replace parts

loans.name: 09- Phố 13 - Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Gai D. T. (237) is a 56-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Gai is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 09- Phố 13 Đông Sơn (10.13.09 Đông Sơn).


Gai is married and has 3 adult children.  To making a living, Gai operates a family member's business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community.  Gai has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Gai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Gai has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gai from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.
