loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en:
Otgonsuren B. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.  Both of her sons attend a local school. 

Otgonsuren and her husband operate a meat trading business in their town.  They started their meat trading business in 2006 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Since 2010, they have been operating their business in Hovd, where it has proven to be a very profitable place to run the business. They sell 2-3 pieces of livestock in per day to their sister's cafe. They have built a stable and successful operation and their earnings have enabled them to buy a car for their business. 

Since operating the business, Otgonsuren has been able to improve her family's standard of living by purchasing many assets for her family. She is a very clever and business minded woman. She needs more funds to buy a large amount of livestock before the price for such products rise. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Moeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas M. is the village bank president, selected by sixteen people who make up this village bank loan in Angk Ta Nu village, Takeo province.  The members use their portion of the loan for their own needs to improve their family living.  

Mrs. Meas M. and her husband, Mr. Korn Khim, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. She also breeds some chickens for selling. Her chicken breeding is going well and she wants to expand. To achieve this purpose, Mrs. Meas M. is applying for a loan to buy more chickens. 

Mrs. Meas M. is a mother of two children, one of whom is employed in garment factory, while the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Mrs. Khat Sophi Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fourteen people living in Angk Ta Nu village, Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. They have selected Mrs. Khat S. to become the village bank president.    

Mrs. Khat S. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She also breeds some chickens.  Her husband, Mr. Vong Um, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they only earn a small income. So to improve her family living, Mrs. Khat S. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business.  With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy more chickens. 

Mrs. Khat S. is a mother of five children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, one is a construction worker, and the others are studying in public school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Siezd

texts.en:
Siezd H. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His four children attend a local school. 

Siezd owns and operates two businesses:  bakery production and a car trading. He started his car trading business in 2005 and has found success,  which enabled  him to start his second business in 2009. He operates his bakery production business with the help of his brother from his workplace, where his brother's wife makes a variety of breads and pastries. 

After years of operation, he has gained much experience as a businessman. Siezd is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more replacement and spare parts for his car selling business.

loans.use: To purchase replacement/spare parts

loans.name: Mylyn's Group

texts.en:
Mylyn C. is from the village of Singson. She is 28 years old. Mylyn is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mylyn C..

Mylyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mylyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mylyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Mylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mylyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mylyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. The total loan amount for the group is 45000 PHP.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Oem Choeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people make up this village bank loan in Angk Ta Nu village, Takeo province. Mrs. Oem C. is the  village bank president who has been selected by the other members.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Oem C. is a teacher who gets a low salary to support her family.  She is also a pig breeder.   Her husband, Mr. Bon M., is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to grow rice to feed his family.  He is also a government worker and has a low salary. 

This couple tries to work hard, but they do not have enough money to pay school fees for their children for this current year. So Mrs. Oem C. is applying for a loan for this purpose. 

Mrs. Oem C. is a mother of five children, one of whom is a teacher, one is employed in a garment factory, and the others are studying in school.

loans.use: To pay for school fee

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en:
Urtnasan B. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest child is a university student and her younger two children both attend secondary school.  Her husband operates a taxi service using his own car to supplement his family income. 

Urtnasan operates a dairy product trading business. She started her dairy product selling business in 2005 after selling a variety of food products such as meat and other products between 1992 and 2005. She is a very hardworking person.  

Urtnasan  is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of dairy products for the upcoming winter's National holiday.  This sale will increase her working capital for her dairy trading business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products in volume

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a hardworking mother who operates a tricycle transport business to earn a living. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a sidecar, used as public utility vehicle. This is more expensive than a motorcycle but the owners have bigger income. 

Her supportive husband is the driver and manages their transport business. The couple offers good transport service for people in their village. She appreciates that the organization has helped her improve her transport business, and hence her standard of living.

She has requested a loan of 30,000 Php to support the maintenance of their tricycle. Specifically, the loan fund will be used to buy needed spare parts for the tricycle. She hopes to buy another tricycle in the future for better income to support her children’s education until they complete college and find great jobs. 

Marife is hoping that her envisioned transport business will help her support the financial needs of her family so that they can to move forward against poverty. By then, Marife positively believe their lives would be changed and she will have her dreams achieved.

The attached picture of Marife was taken December 07, 2010 with her supportive husband, the driver.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for tricycle

loans.name: Dan Mo 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Hang T. N. is 42 years old. She is living in Dan Mo village with her husband and three children. Her children are going to school. She is a farmer. She not only grows rice but also raises chicken and fish. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. 

She has participated in SEDA since 2003 and always repaid punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in her livestock.

 About the other borrowers in her group:

 Van T. L. is 62 years old. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy feed for chickens.

 Hien T. N. is 32 years old. She makes wooden furniture. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy wood.

 Doan T. D. is 35 years old. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to invest in her livestock

loans.name: Prescilla's Group

texts.en:
Prescilla E. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 50 years old. Prescilla is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Prescilla E..

Prescilla is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Prescilla owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Prescilla has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Prescilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prescilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Prescilla is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Prescilla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase items to expand product offering

loans.name: Nancy Gajete's Group

texts.en:
Nancy G. is forty years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of San Jose Norte 1 within the municipality of Mallig, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Nancy is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nancy G.’s Group.

Nancy runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nancy joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from ASKI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers such as manure to sell

loans.name: Beatriz Cristina

texts.es: Beatriz Cristina H. D. L. D. 38 años D. edad, es una madre D. familia responsable y trabajadora la cual vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos D. 10 y 14 años D. edad con quienes resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango. Beatriz tiene como profesión el ser costurera, ella se encarga D. confeccionar ropa formal, uniformes y ropa casual, ella es alguien muy detallista quien desarrolla un trabajo muy bueno, lo que le permite contar con la fidelidad D. muchos clientes como familiares, amigos y vecinos, ya que la responsabilidad es una D. las mejorar cualidades D. ella. Beatriz elabora trabajos por encargo y así mismo elabora prendas D. vestir para vender en su casa D. habitación, donD. también se dedica a elaborar su trabajo. Beatriz solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar telas en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilo, agujas y todo lo necesario para elaborar la ropa, Beatriz posee la certeza que D. esta manera su negocio podrá mejorar y así obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean D. beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en: Beatriz Cristina H. D. Lopez is 38 years old and she is a mother who is responsible and hard working. She lives together with her husband and their two children, aged 10 and 14. The live in the municipality of Soyapango. Beatriz is a seamstress by traD.. She makes formal clothing, uniforms, and casual clothing. She is someone who pays attention to detail and produces high quality work, a fact that has gained her the loyalty of many clients. Her clients are family members, friends, and neighbors. One of her best personal qualities is her sense of responsibility. Beatriz takes orders and she also makes pieces of clothing to sell from her home. She also makes her products at home. Beatriz requests a loan in order to purchase fabrics in various colors and patterns, as well as to purchase threads, needs, and other necessary items to carry out her traD.. Beatriz is certain that she will be able to improve her business, and it will be a benefit to their family.

loans.use: To purchase needles, thread, and fabric.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis Alonso L. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en donde vive junto a su esposa, una hija de 6 años de edad y junto a su madre. Desde hace varios atrás que él se dedica a atender su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos varios como productos para el hogar, para uso personal y productos alimenticios, y una de sus mayores ventajas es que no posee competencia, lo cual es muy beneficioso para él debido a que es el único que vende en el lugar. Su esposa le ayuda a atender la tienda y ambos trabajan con muchos deseos de salir adelante y así mismo de mejorar su negocio, surtiéndolo con todos los productos posibles para obtener más ganancias. Luis solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en la tienda comprando productos como: pan, medicinas, golosinas, diferentes tipos de bebidas, detergentes, granos básicos y muchos productos más los cuales son primordiales en un negocio como este, ya que son los que más se solicitan. Luis desea mucho poder prosperar en su negocio, sobretodo porque es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Luis Alonso L. is 39 years old and he lives in the region of Ahuachapan. He lives together with his wife, their 6-year old daughter, and his mother.  For several years he has had his own business selling household and personal use products as well as food items. One of the greatest advantages is that he does not have any competition. He is the only one with a store in his location. His wife helps him tend to the store and they both work together with a great dream of coming out ahead. They wish to improve their business, supplying it with all types of products, such as: bread, medicines, snacks, various types of drinks, detergents, basic grains, and many other products which are so important to a business of this type. These products are the most in demand. Luis wants to find success for his business especially because it is their only source of income.

loans.use: To purchase general store merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Edgar Mauricio

texts.es: Edgar Mauricio P. V. de 43 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, quien posee un taller de enderezado y pintura. Él reside junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Edgar trabaja muy duro día con día para brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia, su taller esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en donde día con día se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de sí. Él solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar: pintura, cintas adhesivas, herramientas y otros más lo cual es muy esencial en su negocio. Edgar desea mucho salir adelante y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Edgar Mauricio Perez Vasquez is 43 years old. He is a hard working person and he owns an auto body shop. He lives together with his wife and their two young children, both of whom are attending school. Edgar works very hard day after day in order to provide the best for his family. His shop is located where he lives and this is where day after day he invests the best of himself into the work. He requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) in order to purchase paints, adhesive tape, tools and other items that are essential for his work. Edgar's wish is to come out ahead and to increase his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and paint for auto repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn and vegetables.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza E. D. B. D. 40 años D. edad, D. 40 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo D. 11 años D. edad, junto a quienes resiD. en Ilopango. María es muy conocida en su lugar D. vivienda, ya que es muy buena vecina y amiga.  Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar y su hijo, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder a sus clientes, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio. María es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella familia, la cual es la mayor inspiración para ella y la razón D. la solicitud D. dicho préstamo ya que solo D. esta manera podrá mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Maria Esperanza E. D. Beltran is 40 years old. She lives together with her husband and their 11 year old son. They live in Ilopango. Maria is well known in her community, for being such a good neighbor and friend. She has a produce market that she runs from her home. The business grants her the ability to have all that is necessary for the home and to proviD. for her son. She requests a loan to use as working capital, to equip her business with all that is necessary to proviD. a better quality of service. There have been various occasions when she lost clients for the lack of products they sought. She wants to change all that by improving her business. Maria is a visionary that dreams of coming out ahead and to work day after day for the sake of her family. They are her greatest inspiration and it is the reason why she has requested a loan. It is the only way for her to improve her sales

loans.use: To purchse general food products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Sara Yanira

texts.es: Sara Yanira I. de 36 años de edad, es una madre muy responsable y trabajadora la cual vive junto a su compañero de vida, y dos hijos de 16 y 17 años de edad, junto a los cuales reside en el municipio de Ilopango. Sara se dedica la venta de pollo, negocio en el cual trabaja desde hace 6 años atrás y gracias al cual puede contar con una vida digna junto a su familia. El negocio se encuentra en el mercado de San Martín, en donde es muy conocida por su excelente servicio. Sara solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de pollos, sobretodo para esta temporada de fin de años en donde los pollos se vuelven el platillo principal para las celebraciones. El mayor dese de Sara es el de poder incrementar sus ventas y poder iniciar un año mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en: Sara Yanira I. is 36 years old. She is a mother who is very responsible and hard working. She lives together with her life partner and their two children, aged 16 and 17 years old. They live in the municipality of Ilopango. Sara sells chicken, a business that she has had for the past 6 years. It is thanks to this business that she is able to provide dignity in life for her family. The business is located in the market of San Martin where she is well known for her excellent service. Sara requests a loan to purchase greater quantities of chicken, especially important during the end of year season when chicken is the most consumed food during the celebrations. Sara's greatest wish is to increase her sales and to start the new year on a better footing alongside her family.

loans.use: To purchase chicken for resale.

loans.name: Karen Aracely

texts.es: Karen Aracely S. M. de 24 años de edad, es un joven muy emprendedora, quien ha tenido que trabajar muy duro por sacar adelante a sus dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, ya que ella a su corta edad es viuda, y se ha visto obligada a tomar las riendas de su familia. Karen se dedica a la venta de productos de uso domésticos, así también vende galletas, huevos, sopas, Shampoo, cremas y otros más. Su venta es ambulante debido a que cada día ella se coloca en las aceras del municipio de Mejicanos, mismo lugar en el cual reside. Karen con todo el deseo de poder superarse y darles una vida mejor a sus hijos, solicita un préstamo a Integral, y de esta manera surtir su negocio con más productos los cuales le brinden mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Karen Aracely S. Martinez is 24 years old. She is a young and enterprising woman who has had to work very hard in order to provide for her two children, aged 9 and 2. In her young age she is already a widow. She has been forced to take care of her family on her own. Karen sells household products. She makes her sales in the streets every day, staying close to the municipality of Mejicanos, the same neighborhood where she lives. Karen wants with all her heart and all her might to improve herself and to provide her children with a better life. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to be supply her store with more products in order to improve her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase general store products for resale.

loans.name: Berta Isabel

texts.es: Berta Isabel O. de 50 años de edad, posee su propio negocio en el cual se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tostadas de yuca, chicharrón y plátanos, los cuales son un tipo de golosina artesanal muy típica de esta región. Ella vive junto a su familia la cual es muy grande y esta conformada por su hijo, nuera, dos nietos, dos sobrinos y su madre, Berta trabaja para poder sostenerse a su madre y para sus gastos personales. Berta comercializa su producto de forma ambulante por diferentes lugares del departamento de San Salvador, mismo departamento en el cual reside. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: yuca, plátanos y chicharrones para elaborar las golosinas y de esta forma brindarle a sus clientes más productos.
texts.en: Berta Isabel O. is 50 years old. She has her own business making and selling prepared foods made from yucca, pork rinds, and bananas. They are traditional snack foods that are very common in the region. She lives together with her very large family. Her family is made up of her son and his wife, their two children, two nephews and her mother. Berta works in order to support herself and her mother, providing for personal expenses. Berta sells her products in various locales in the region of San Salvador, the same neighborhood where she lives. She requests a loan in order to purchase ingredients in wholesale, such as: yucca, bananas, and pork rinds. She will be able to make greater quantities of her products and be able to sell more to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana María Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana María Del Carmen S. D. C. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos D. los cuales los mayores trabajan y el menor se dedica a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a su nieta a la cual cuida durante el día. Ana posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio. Ana es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella y su familia.
texts.en: Ana María Del Carmen S. D. C., 60, lives in the "departamento" of San Salvador with her husband and three children.  Her two oldest children are grown, with jobs of their own, and her youngest child is still in school.  She also has a granddaughter who she cares for during the day.  Ana owns a grocery business that she operates from her house.  She sells the everyday commodities that everyone needs.  She is applying for a loan so that she can pull together enough money to stock her business and, in turn, proviD. a better service to her customers.  Ana is a very forward-looking woman, always striving to get ahead, and working hard, day after day, for herself and her family.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for making pupusas and tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and farm tools

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es: José Mario C. M. de 53 años de edad, reside en  Zacatecoluca, en el departamento de La Paz. José es padre soltero de 5 hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Él posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, lugar muy concurrido en el cual las ventas son muy estables. Sus hijos le ayudan a la elaboración del pan y a atender el negocio cuando José se encuentra afuera repartiendo el pan. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar todos los insumos necesarios como: harina, miel, azúcar, mantequilla y otros más. José es un hombre muy responsable quien trabaja arduamente para brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, es por esto que para él, mantener las ganancias estables es de mucha importancia, ya que la panadería es su única fuente de ingresos, por ello es necesario esforzarse por mejorarla día con día en su servicio.
texts.en:
José Mario C. M. is 53 years old.  He lives in Zacatecoluca, in La Paz department.  José is a single father.  His 5 children are all studying.  José owns a bakery which is located in his home.  His business is very busy and his sales are stable.  His children help him make the bread and serve in the business when he is out delivering bread.

José is requesting a loan so that he has the money he needs to buy all the necessary supplies for his business such as: flour, honey, sugar, butter, etc.  José is a very responsible man who works hard so that he can provide his children with the best.  This is why, for him, keeping his profits stable is very important since the bakery is his only source of income.  This means that he has to work hard to improve it every day.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia G. D. A. D. 63 años D. edad, vive sola en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, ella es una persona muy alegre, responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, quien cuenta con muy buena referencias por parte D. sus vecinos. María posee una venta D. granos básicos, aceite para cocina, saborizantes, especias y otros más. Su negocio se encuentra en el mercado D. Ahuachapán, y por tener muchos años D. vender en el mismo lugar cuenta con varios clientes los cuales son muy fieles a ella. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir el negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. productos sobretodo granos básicos los cuales poseen más demanda. María trabaja mucho D. lunes a domingo con el deseo D. que nunca le haga falta lo más esencial para vivir.
texts.en:
María Antonia G. D. A. is 63 years old and lives alone in Ahuachapán department.  She is a very happy, responsible person who is committed to her work and has very good references from her neighbors.  María owns a business selling basic grains, cooking oil, flavorings, spices, etc.  Her business is in Ahuachapán Market and as she has been selling in the same place for many years, she has a number of very loyal customers.

María is requesting a loan so that she can stock her business, buying a larger quantity of products, especially basic grains which are in most demand.  María works hard from Monday to Sunday so that she never lacks the basic necessities in life.

loans.use: To buy basic grains to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items to expand his business

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia Z. L., vive junto a dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y quienes dependen por completo de Marta, ella reside junto a su familia en Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador. Marta posee un bazar en el que comercializa: accesorios para regalar, centros de mesa, juguetes y así mismo comercializa diferentes tipos de papelería. Su negocio es bastante estable, razón por la que desea aumentar su inventario y de esta forma mejorar sus ganancias, ya que de esta manera ella podrá atender a más clientes, ofreciéndoles nuevos productos. Por esta razón,  Marta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda aumentar sus productos.
texts.en: Marta Alicia Z. L. lives with her two children who are studying and who are completely dependent on her.  She lives with her family in Soyapango, in San Salvador department.  Marta owns a stationery store in which she sells: gifts, table decorations and toys as well as different types of stationery.  Her business is quite stable and, for this reason, she would like to increase her inventory and thereby improve her profits as she will be able to serve more customers, offering them new products.  Marta is requesting a loan which will allow her to increase her number of products.

loans.use: To buy paper and different types of accessories to sell

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.en:
Erkingul B. is 59, married and has two sons; her eldest lives on his own and the younger one lives with parents and supports them. Erkingul graduated from Trade College and worked as an accountant for 38 years at Kyrgyzmail. Now she is on pension. But being a very energetic person, she decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. With the initial capital of 15,000 KGS, she managed to raise her floating capital to 35,000 KGS and now has a farm with sheep. 

Erkingul is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase one milk cow and sheep in order to increase the number of cattle. With the revenues, she plans to pay for her son’s marriage.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is an active entrepreneur managing three ventures- sari-sari (variety) store business, frozen foods and little carenderia (ready-to-eat-food). Her previous loan from KIVA has provided working capital to expand her businesses and purchase more inventory for her ventures.

With the loan, Purita has witnessed that her monthly income has almost doubled, since she has attracted more customers with additional stock. Positive growth from her businesses has helped Purita finance the education of her children. All of them finished college and are now seeking better employment. 

Since joining ASHI, Purita has experienced positive changes in her life. She uses the additional income to support maintenance of her three ventures. Purita hopes her businesses will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family. 

Therefore, she is now requesting another KIVA loan, this time for 45,000 PHP, to purchase more inventories of food stuffs for her store, greater supply of frozen foods products, and more ingredients for her food preparation. This will allow her to grow her businesses further so that she will able to help fund the education of her grandchildren and experience a life that’s full of contentment.

With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Purita is hopeful that her businesses will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life, out from the spiral of poverty. Purita hopes that her businesses will expand, so she will have savings for future use.

As a member of ASHI for almost ten years, she has shown very good performance in her credit rating (basis of loans); therefore, she is being trusted by the institution to acquire larger loans.
 
The attached picture of Purita was taken December 07, 2010 with her supportive husband and her granddaughter.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of food stuffs for her store, a greater supply of frozen foods products, and more ingredients for her food preparation (ready-to-eat-food)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To meet needs for genenral store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Biahmet

texts.en:
Biahmet N. is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son is university student and the younger two children both attend a local high school. 

Biahmet operates a livestock trading business in his province. He purchases livestock from the countryside and neighbouring towns at wholesale price and transports them using his own jeep to sell those livestock at his local town as a retailer. He started his livestock trading business in 2008 after operating a meat trading business since 2000. 

After many years of operation, he has gained much experience as a businessman and has built a stable operation. Biahmet is a very honest and hardworking man and says, "All I want is to improve my family's standard of living." He is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock at wholesale prices from the countryside.

loans.use: To purchase livestock at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tools and wood for carpentry business

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson Z. is from the village of San Roque. He is 45 years old. Anderson is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Anderson owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anderson has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Anderson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anderson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Anderson is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Anderson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Humar

texts.en:
Humar Z. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent.  All his three children attend a local secondary school. 

Humar operates a transportation service with the help of his wife, where he transports people in his town using his own minibus. He drives his bus to transport people while his wife works as a conductor in his minibus. He started his transportation business in 2007 and has gained a lot of experience in his business. He has built a successful and stable operation with his business, and his earnings have enabled him to provide for his entire family. 

Humar needs more fund to repairs his minibus so that they can continue operating their business for a living. Humar is a very clever man and says, " I want to buy one more minibus in order to expand my business."   He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan in order to purchase tires for his vehicle and make necessary repairs on his vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase tires and make vehicle repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S. is 40 years old and a married man who is a villager in Kompong Chhnang Province. Meas S. married years ago and he has two children who live with him until the present time. 

Meas S. is currently a recycled goods seller: he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Additionally, his wife is employed as a worker in a garment factory and has a formal salary. 

Meas S.’s wife wants to start up a new business as a food seller, and she hopes to buy a kiosk in front of the factory where she works at present.  Meas S. will use his loan to encourage his wife to start this business.

loans.use: To buy a kiosk in front of the factory for food selling

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine K. K. is thirty years old. She is married and her husband works with Better Health Care. They have three children aged between eight years old and three years old. Her business is located in a busy commercial area known as Mlolongo and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She has a grocery store in which she stocks vegetables and fruit. She has been in this business for three years now and she says most of her customers are repeat customers. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 70,000 to buy vegetables and potatoes to expand her business. In future, she hopes to be a wholesaler. She describes herself as very hardworking, punctual and honest.

loans.use: Vegetables and Potatoes

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias Z. is from the village of San Roque. He is 55 years old. Jeremias is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Jeremias owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jeremias has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jeremias joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeremias has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Jeremias is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Jeremias from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Bayan-Ulgii province, western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student while her other four children all attend a local school. May operates a construction business specializing in interior and exterior decoration of buildings. Her husband helps her business by working as an assistant worker. They have done previously many decorations on big supermarkets and store houses. They have owned this business for almost 10 years and over this long time they have earned a good reputation among their customers because of the quality of their work and service. Their earnings have enabled them to provide for their family. 

May is a very open-minded and a hard-working woman and says, “My only wish is to continue to run my business with stable operation so that I can establish my own construction company in the future.” She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials and tools for her construction business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to make his shop larger

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of San Roque. She is 35 years old. Evangeline is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Togtamurat

texts.en:
Togtamurat I. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He has been living with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent for past 12 years. His oldest two sons both operate their own private businesses and his middle son is a university student. His youngest two daughters attend a local school. 

Togtamurat and his wife operate a vegetable selling business in their town. He procures his products in the  countryside using his own truck while his wife works as a salesperson in the local market selling a variety of vegetables as a retailer. Their stall is located in a popular spot and attracts many customers which has resulted in increasing their sales. They started buying and selling vegetables in 2000 and have since built a stable operation. After years of successful operation, he was able to provide his family with earnings that has enabled him to pay his son's tuition fees. He uses his truck to convey the goods. Togtamurat is a modest man and says, "All I want is to provide a higher education for my two  daughters."  

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his vegetable trading business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Hannah Ene

texts.en:
Hannah has been operating a posho mill (grinding maize into flour) business in Naivasha town for the last six years. She is 27 years old and married to Sale Kasilimo. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to boost her stock by buying 28 bags of maize

In the future she hopes to expand her posho mill business and  venture into other businesses that will generate additional income

loans.use: Boosting her stock by buying 28 bags of maize

loans.name: Mikias

texts.en:
Mikias B. is from the village of San Roque. He is 56 years old. Mikias is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mikias owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mikias has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mikias joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mikias has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Mikias is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Mikias from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Muhtar

texts.en:
Muhtar M. is 45 years old, married and has two children. Muhtar was born to a low-income farmworker’s family and, from early childhood, had engaged in farming. After graduating from college as a drilling foreman, he had to return to his native village in order to take care of his mother, who stayed alone after his father’s death. In his area of the country, cattle breeding is the main activity, that’s why Muhtar decided to engage in livestock breeding also.

 He started this business with 9,000 KGS and managed to broaden his business with milk cows, whose milk he and his wife, Shailoogul, sell to the local diary factory. In 2009, Muhtar obtained his first loan for purchasing cattle and repaid it without any delays. Now, Muhtar plans to use this loan of 135,000 KGS to buy cows, which will increase their milk sales. With the revenues, Muhtar wants to pay for a good education for his children. 
Muhtar is very positive and hard-working person, who believes that his efforts will lead his family to prosperous future.   

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en:
Dorn Chan earns her living by weaving bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes many sets of baskets then resells them. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband also assists her for selling and weaving baskets. 

Recently, Dorn Chan has run out of essential materials from her stock of supplies and she hopes to acquire other raw materials to continue making baskets. She depends on her Kiva loan to buy supplies. The family lives with one child who is studying in school.

loans.use: To acquire other raw materials to continue making baskets.

loans.name: Hibat

texts.en:
Hibat D. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own house and property. His oldest daughter attends a local primary school while his youngest daughter is in kindergarten. Hibat owns a transportation service where he transports people using his own car between local sub provinces. He transports 8 people at one trip and charges 15,000 MNT per passenger. He makes 2-3 trips in one day. He started his transportation business in 2004 and has gained a lot of experience in his business. He has build a successful and stable operation over the years and his earnings have enabled him to buy a new car for himself. After years of operation, he was able to build a house for his family. His monthly average income has reached  a level of between 900,000 and 1,200,000 MNT with 20-30 % of net profit. 

Hibat is a very honest and hardworking man and says, " I want to start saving my business profits in order to invest money for my children's future. " He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy and resell grocery products from the towns he where he travels.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products for his new business

loans.name: Janarbek

texts.en:
Janarbek is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children, aged between 2 and 7, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son attends a local primary school while his youngest two daughters are in kindergarten. 

Janarbek operates a car repair and service business. He started his business in 2000 by providing a car repair on call service and since then he has found a success in his business which was allowed him to open his own car repair shop. In addition to supplementing his earnings, he purchased old cars in order to resell them after making repairs which gives him considerable profit. For the future, he hopes to expand his car repair center. 

Janarbek is a modest and decent person and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his car repair center.

loans.use: To expand his car repair center

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is thankful for your support and the opportunity to borrow money for her first kiva loan. Myrna is very happy that, with the loan she is able to provide satisfactory services to her regular customer without delay.  She wishes to access a larger loan to expand her printing business where he can earn more profit. Myrna thanks KIVA for providing her with opportunity to increase her income. Your support is important to her family and they are very grateful.

Now she is proposing another kiva loan of 35,000 Philippine pesos to support her printing business and purchase needed supplies for their farming business. Stock includes items such as T-shirts for printing, assorted paints, and silk. Tthe loan will also be used for purchasing fertilizer for their farming business.

If her businesses provide them with more profit, she wants to save for the future of her family, especially her grandchildren. Myrna wants them to complete their studies through college.Her long-term goal is to have an expanded printing business that will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and maintain her family’s quality of living.

Myrna is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support to her business dreams. Myrna wishes all lenders all the best and good luck and will continue to support her family and the expanded business.

loans.use: To provide support for her printing business and purchase needed supplies of their farming business.

loans.name: Ketemon Ene

texts.en:
Ketemon has been in livestock farming in Naivasha town for the last six years. She is a 50-year-old lady married to Leulele K.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy 15 sheep and 10 goats in oder to meet the high demand during the festive season.


In the future she hopes to be a major supplier of livestock to slaughter houses in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep and 10 goats to rear and sell later during the festive season

loans.name: Karamatkan

texts.en:
Karamatkan M. was born in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She was one of the eight children in a large family of workers. After finishing school, she couldn’t continue her studies because of the limited family income and had to help her parents in rice growing and cattle breeding. She got married to a farmworker and has been in a  happy marriage for 27 years. Her husband works as a welder. Karamatkan is the mother of eight children. Her four daughters help her with milking cows at the farm and sons are help their father with welding. Today all Karamatkan’s family lives in Kara-Balta town, where they moved in 2000. 

In 2001, as a  means of income, she decided to begin her business of cattle breeding. Due to her vast experience in this activity, Karamatkan managed to maintain the farm with three milk cows and one bull. Now Karamatkan is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy additional cattle. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by purchasing more livestock. As for the future, Karamatkan dreams of building a big house, where she could hold her sons' weddings and look after her future grandchildren.
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the needs of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kipino Ole

texts.en:
Kipino is 32 years old and married to Motayian ene Kipino. They have three children. For the last eight years, Kipino has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town.

A friend introduced Kipino to KADET LTD and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy five bulls that he will raise and sell later at a profit. In the future, Kipino hopes to begin large-scale farming and have dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy five bulls

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn T. is a married woman whose daily routine includes making baske. Sourn T. and her husband must buy raw materials to make baskets to sell at the market. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profits. They have done this since 1985. Sourn T. is a mother who has only a child who is still in public school. In order to get additional income, Sourn T. will be using her loan to purchase more baskets to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her basket selling business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a thirty-eight-year-old single mother of two living in her own house in Fort Porta, Uganda, with a desire to buy land for the family. She has a retail shop and she is also a farmer, which has enabled her to educate her children. Her aspiration is to set up a shop in town and also to become a commercial farmer. Ruth needs the loan to weed her field.

loans.use: Weed her field.

loans.name: Majilyn

texts.en:
Majilyn Z. is from the village of San Roque. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Majilyn plants and harvests rice to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $161 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Majilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Majilyn is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Shakirt

texts.en:
Shakirt T. is a 56-year-old single father who lives with his three children in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own fenced house. His youngest, a daughter, attends the university. One of his sons is a taxi driver in the town and the other is unemployed. 

Shakirt operates a chicken and cow farm. He owns three cows and ten chickens, which gives him milk and eggs to sell. His three cows produce nine liters of milk in one day and he sells the milk by the liter to his neighboring households with a price of 1,500 to 2,000 MNT. He sells eggs with a price of 300 to 500 MNT each. His daily sales income is between $16 and $25 with a 25-30% net profit. In the future, he plans to increase the numbers of his cows and chickens. 

Shakirt is an honest and hardworking man and says, "I want to support my children using my business profits." He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan in order to buy more hay for his cows and feed for his chickens.

loans.use: To buy more hay for his cows and feed for his chickens

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is a married lady. Her husband is a contractor and they have three children between the ages of fifteen and four, for whom they hope to provide quality education to the university level. 

Esther's business is located in a market known as Kongowea-karama in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the white beaches of the Indian Ocean. She has been selling electrical goods for the last ten years, including sockets, phone cases, batteries, air conditioners and others, to the local people and to other retailers. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 80,000 KES to buy more stocks of electrical goods to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She describes herself as honest, open minded and focused.

loans.use: To buy more sockets, phone cases, etc. to sell

loans.name: Santayian Ole

texts.en:
Santayian has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last 20 years. He is 50 years old, married to Nemunyera Ene Satayian and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy  five cows which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Santayian hopes to expand his herd and also develop his plot of land located in Naivasha town centre.

loans.use: To buy  five  cows which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating her children. She is a business woman operating a retail shop, which she has done for ten years. Her business dream is to become a wholesale trader. Martha needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and tea leaves to resell.

loans.use: Buying soap, sugar and tea leaves to resell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean B. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and hair cutting businesses. She lives in Purok Linasgasan, Brgy Bato, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her food vending and hair cutting businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. Jean is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase raw materials for food vending. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP10,000 which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Jean aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to make his shop larger

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem S., 34 years old, owns a small shop located along the street where she sells soft drinks and fast food. She typically makes around US$ 1.80 in profit per day. Soem S. now has two school-aged kids, both of whom are attending school. Soem S. is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her clients. Her husband is a motor taxi driver in and around the province of Kompong Chhnang. 

Besides this sales business, Soem S. is also a local farmer, who can grow her rice crop at least twice a year, and right now, it is a good time for planting a dry-season rice field. So Soem S. would like to request a loan to be used to buy fertilizers and seeds to plant in her dry-season rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds to plant in dry-season rice field.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy  A. is a widow  who lives in Putting Bato, Washington, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a sari-sari (general) store  business. She has 3 children who are 15 to 24 years old. 

Lucy  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lucy  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and cover their daily needs. Lucy  A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rizal

texts.en:
Rizal T. is from the village of Sta. Cruz. He is 54 years old. Rizal is married and has three children. To make a living, Rizal owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Rizal has been engaged in his business for over 34 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rizal joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizal has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rizal is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rizal from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary A. W. is 38 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 12 and 21. Her business is located in a residential area of Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is part of the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attractions, not forgetting the white beaches of the Indian Ocean. She provides tailoring services to the local people. She makes and repairs their clothes. She has been in this business for the last fifteen years and has one employee. She says that this business is profitable, though her major challenge is debtors who don't pay on time, and others who don't pay at all. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 80,000 KES to buy more material to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business, get a more spacious premises, and give knowledge to people who want to do the kind of business she does. She also hopes to give her children a quality university education. She describes herself as friendly and welcoming.

loans.use: To buy more material

loans.name: Anastasiya

texts.en:
Anastasiya is married and has a small son. She sells all kinds of souvenirs at an open market in Novaya Kahovka. Anastasiya started this business nine years ago because she needed to support her family. Today her business is going well. Anastasiya enjoys selling souvenirs very much and would like to develop her business further. 

Anastasiya is requesting a loan of 12,000 grivnas to increase the assortment of souvenirs to sell during this Christmas season. Anastasiya is hoping to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of souvenirs

loans.name: Jackson Soala

texts.en:
Jackson has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last 10 years. He is 38 years old, married to Leloe Esther, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep  and two cows which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Jackson aspires to venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep  and two  cows which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 30-year-old man, married to a teacher with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children. He is into motorcycle transport and has been in the sector for six years. He is still reaping tangible results and has an ambition to have at least three motorcycles. Andrew needs the credit to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin G. is from the village of Sta. Cruz. He is 43 years old. Edwin is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Edwin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Edwin has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edwin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Edwin is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Edwin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy necessary materials for her quilts

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy M. (shown in the photo) is 30 years old. Her husband, Mr. Phally Ny, is 22. They have been married since 2008 and have a one-year-old son. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sophy has been a tailor since 2007. She operates the business at home. Her husband is a lathe operator. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita I. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating fishing and fish-selling businesses. She lives in Purok Dungcaan, Barangay Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending/fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $229. Mercedita is borrowing 24,000 PHP to use as additional capital and to purchase fishing supplies. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 21,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Mercedita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. This photo was taken after the center meeting, because fish were delivered early in the morning. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional capital and to purchase fishing supplies

loans.name: John Nduati

texts.en:
John is 40 years old, supporting a family of two, and Lydia Njeri is the spouse, helping in the farm as a source of income. He has been farming for the past 20 years with an income of about 8,000 Kenya shillings a month.


This is his first loan with Kadet and he wants to use it to buy an extra dairy cow in order to increase milk production.He hopes to start a retail shop for the family and to improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy an extra dairy cow

loans.name: Taddeo

texts.en: Taddeo is a 26-year-old married man with three children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels of education. He is a businessman who has operated a retail shop for three years. The income generated has helped him pay school fees for his children. Taddeo needs the credit facility's loan to buy soap, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.use: Buying soap, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita A. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and a buy-and-sell dried fish business. She lives in Purok Mahogany, Barangay Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and dried fish businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $184. Nenita is now borrowing 25,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her business. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 23,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nenita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.
