loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon L. is a 25-year-old woman who currently lives in Kompong Chhnang Province in Cambodia with her parent, who sells baskets. She works in the local garment factory sewing clothing, and she earns a monthly salary from this job. She will get married next month, but her personal savings balance is not sufficient to hold a wedding party. So Nuon L. made a decision to borrow some funds from Kiva to add to her savings to prepare for her wedding.

loans.use: To add to her savings to prepare for her wedding.

loans.name: Flordemie

texts.en:
Flordemie D. is from the village of Tigbao. She is 26 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Flordemie owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Flordemie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP per month from these activities.
     
In 2010, Flordemie joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Flordemie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn J. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Balayagmanok, Bacong, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: selling ready-to-wear clothes, operating a small canteen in a school and running a livestock business. Her husband, Reynaldo, who is 45 years old, works as a pedicab driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's businesses. They have three children aged between 9 and 17.
Jovelyn joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jovelyn has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,800 PHP, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her tenth loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy piglets to raise and more ready-to-wear clothes to sell so that she could continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Jovelyn J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma S., from the village of Sta. Cruz, is 41 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting corn for sale. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure, she is now requesting her fourth loan of 30000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. Gemma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida runs a sari-sari store. Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. “Sari” is a native word for variety. This is a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far away from the owner’s house. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the market place.

Zenaida started her variety store through her initiative of dealing with people. She wants to continue her business, providing as it does sufficient proceeds to support the educational needs of her children.

She is requesting a loan of PHP25,000.00 to buy more food products and basic household necessities for the store. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales.

In order to allow her children to achieve college educations, Zenaida dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to other villages. She aspires for each of her children to have their own beautiful house for comfortable living. They are her sole inspiration for succeeding in business.

Zenaida feels very happy about the ASHI and KIVA partnership. It gives people the chance to pursue their family dreams. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead. She has proven herself to be hard-working as she steadily strives to improve the productivity of her business and advance her family's overall quality of living.

loans.use: To buy more food products and basic household necessities.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza V. is a 30-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a ready-to-wear clothes business. She lives in Purok Masinolondon, Brgy Paraiso, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her ready-to-wear clothes business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP.
Riza is now borrowing 25,000 PHP so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her eleventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Riza aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Mrs. Lam M. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Thorn, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple was married in 1990 and has three children – two sons and a daughter.
Lam is a weaver. Her husband runs a grocery store at home. Lam is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase weaving material for continuing her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving material

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M. is a married woman who lives in Purok Kalubihan, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by operating a fish vending/fishing business. Her husband, Carlos M., who is 60 years old, helps in his wife's business. They have eight children aged between 16 and 38. Three of them are already married, two are working, while the other three are currently in school.
Rosita joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosita has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase new materials for fishing. She wants to continue to save up for the future, sustain their daily needs and provide for the education of her children. Rosita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.
Note: the photo was taken during the center meeting because the fish was sold already.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im N. is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. Besides her farm work, she also sells  fish in the local market. 

She and her husband have two school-aged children. They live together in a medium sized home. 

She has been planting rice crops since 1998, a skill she  learned from her grandparents. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. The coming rainfall is good for her crop,

Im N. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, Im N. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, a pump machine and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizers, pump machine and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mr. Chinda M. (in the photo), 25, is single and lives with his parents and brothers and sister on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Capital city of Cambodia.

Chinda is a construction worker and raises cows at home. He is requesting his first loan of US$200 to add to his own money to purchase more cows to raise.

When the cows give birth, he will be able to get income from selling the calves or when the cows grow to full size, he will be able to sell the cows for beef.

loans.use: To add to his own money to purchase more cows to raise.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a businessman from Novaya Kahovka. He owns a small business selling office appliances, related components and expendable materials in one of the local malls called “Central.” He launched this business about 12 years ago. Currently, his business has grown up to 20,000 UAH in monthly turnover. His monthly net profit is about 7,000 UAH.

Andrei has used microloans before and found them very instrumental for his business development. This time Andrei is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase parts, expendables and other inventory items. A portion of profits generated will be invested in his business while some of it will be used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase parts, expendables and other inventory items

loans.name: Thourn

texts.en:
Mr. Thourn O. (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Onn Bou, have been married since 1988 and have five children -- four sons and one daughter. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thourn is a wooden-house constructor. His business is doing well, and he hopes to respond his customers' needs. Therefore, Thourn is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to work.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials for his construction business.

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera F. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending / fishing business. She lives in Talusan, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1992 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her fish vending/fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP8,000.  Sotera is borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can purchase materials and do repairs on her pump boat. 

This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Sotera aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

Letecia joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family. This time, for her 24th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to repair and maintain her fishing boat so that she could continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and education of her children. Letecia B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang R. is a widowed mother who lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She has two children, both of whom are married but still living with her under her roof.
Hang Ro is good at making bamboo baskets to sell at the market. Besides this business, she is also a local farmer and has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Hang R. and her family, she has requested a loan to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale

Merfilita joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merfilita has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 40,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 28,000 PHP, thus raising the family's standard of living.
This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing 40,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock for the general store and invest in a new business so that she could continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Merfilita E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Lutengo Development Group A-Mukono

texts.en:
61-year-old N. Teo's steadfast and unwavering resolve has seen her make significant headway in her 13-year-old food and liquor sales business in Lutengo-Mukono. It is a business that she says she began with persuasion from her husband. The business attracts mostly middle and low income earners in and around Lutengo. Before this, she was more inclined to a mat sales business.

 For the future, Teo is envisaging making more strides in terms of the expansion of her business. Teo is happily married with 3 children; weekly this business brings in shillings 70,000. With this loan, she says she is going to buy more food and liquor for resale. She belongs to Lutengo development group A- Mukono.

loans.use: The purchase of more food and liquor for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen H. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  general store, rice dealer and cafeteria businesses. She lives in Brgy. 4, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her general store, rice dealer and cafeteria businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 23,000.  Carmen is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she  can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Carmen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn J. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Batang, Brgy. Talaban, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   general store, fishing and food vending businesses.  Her husband Larry J., who is 47 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 19 to 25 years old.  

Jocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jocelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and the education of her children.  Jocelyn J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her general store

loans.name: Eric Vahn

texts.en:
Eric Vahn A. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. He is 41 years old. Eric Vahn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Eric Vahn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eric Vahn has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eric Vahn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eric Vahn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Eric Vahn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Eric Vahn from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna D. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: a frozen foods business.  She lives in Brgy. Babajuba Junob, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

 By working hard in her frozen foods business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,500.  Anna is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she  can continue to fund the operations of her frozen foods business.   This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Anna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her frozen foods business

loans.name: Crispus Wanyeki

texts.en:
Crispus has been repairing vehicles for the last three years. He wants to buy a pressure pump that will help him in his mechanical work. He got to know about KADET through a friend and has never taken a loan elsewhere apart from Kadet. This is his first loan and he hopes that from the proceeds, he will open a garage of his own. Currently he operates out of a rented space.

Crispus is 35 years old and not married, but he supports his mother. He has plans to marry soon and so he wants to expand his business so that he can become stable to support a family of his own.

loans.use: buy a pressure pump for Kshs 20,000

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan N. weaves bamboo baskets for sale. He sells his finished products to buyers in and around Kompong Chhnang Province. Chan N. and his wife make over 30 sets of baskets before selling their output. They also order baskets from the other villagers and sell them for additional income. This couple is blessed with three children, all of whom are single, and they are still learning in public school. They often help them when they have free time from their studying. Currently, Chan N.’s house is broken down in some parts because of heavy rain and it is not comfortable for him and his family to live in. To solve this problem, Chan N. would like to use his loan to purchase some pieces of wood to repair the broken part of his house.

loans.use: To purchase some pieces of wood to repair the broken part of his house.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed R. is the mother of one son and one daughter. She helps her husband run the small studio he started two and a half years ago. Taghreed's husband, Anas, works with the Miadeen Group of media and advertising and he has gained some good experience in his field. He started his own studio where he provides services such as still and motion photography, video taping for parties and weddings and producing advertisements for companies.

Taghreed came to FATEN for a loan as her husband would like to purchase a new camera and lighting accessories. Taghreed's husband Anas is pictured in the studio as Taghreed is a conservative woman.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase a camera and lighting accessories

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina C. is 51 years old and was born in Russia. Her father was a builder and her mother was a schoolteacher. Sadly, in 1964, when Irina was five years old, her mother died and her father decided to move to Kyrgyzstan, to Kara-Balta town. 

From her childhood, Irina was eager to study and, after graduating from secondary school, she entered college and then became an engineer at a breadstuffs factory. In 1984, Irina got married and soon became the mother of two girls. 

In 1994, using money which they had put aside for a rainy day, Irina’s family moved to Alekseevka village. There, they decided to start their own business selling groceries. They rented a small shop and made every effort to develop it. Irina’s life was supposed to be stable and prosperous, but hard tragedy disrupted all the plans of the family – their younger daughter, who was the light of Irina’s life, died in a car accident. As time passed by, Irina and her husband found strength to bear up under this severe test and continue to move ahead. 

In 2009, Irina took out her first loan and redeemed her little shop. Now, Irina needs to broaden the assortment of goods in her shop, and for this reason, she is applying for a loan of 90,000 KGS. It will allow her to expand her business and attract new customers.   

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Beathe is 29 years old and married to a petrol station attendant. She has one child who is three years old. Beathe is the group leader of the borrowing group called "Abanyamurava", which means "people with commitment" in English.  The group members work in different businesses but have come together to request a loan to help the growth of their businesses. All these borrowers are committed to their work and ability to repay. 

Beathe, the group leader, owns a shop selling both men and women's clothing and she has had this business for one year.  She hopes to add more classic styles of clothing with the loan and she is determined to put aside savings out of the profits. Beathe is wearing a blue dress with necklaces and is standing behind the first row.  She would like to be a distributor of garments after one year.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Meliton

texts.en:
Meliton A. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. He is 54 years old. Meliton is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Meliton owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Meliton has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Meliton joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meliton has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

loans.name: Violeta

Violeta P. is a married woman who lives in Purok Toong, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating one business venture: buying and selling religious articles.  Her husband Leopoldo P., who is 55 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with two grown children. She lives in Novaya Kahovka. Nadezhda sells clothing at one the local marketplaces in her home town. She has been in this business for 16 years. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 25,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is 7,000 Grivnyas a month. Nadezhda has 36,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 13,000 Grivnyas to increase her assortment of winter inventory. She is an experienced entrepreneur who understands the demand and uses her knowledge to attract more customers. Nadezhda says her business is the main source of income for her family which is why she works hard to keep it running efficiently and bringing in a stable income.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of winter inventory

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch P., 29, is a local farmer who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. Touch P. earns about $1 per day. His wife, Mrs. Neang Sokunthea, is a 25 year-old farmer who also makes about $1.  With two young children and growing family expenses, Touch P. needs to increase his income. He is requesting funds to purchase and raise small pigs and to purchase ducklings for eggs. By using the Kiva loan, he will get a higher profit and will be able to support his family effectively.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to rise and ducklings to lay egg.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020054) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội 02 (2).

H. is married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns and operates a furniture making business venture in the manufacturing sector.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Nghị (0) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


4.  Đặng Thị N. (0) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020054) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm H. trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính T. của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương T. tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Nghị (0) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  Đặng Thị N. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Jackson Ikutwa

texts.en: Jackson is 41 years old and single. For the last three years, he has been in the motorcycle business. A friend who is also a KADET client introduced him to the organization and this will be Jackson’s first loan from KADET. He has never borrowed from a microfinance institution before.  Jackson will use this loan to purchase another motorbike to improve his customer service. In the future, he aspires to owning a chain of taxis.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Dionesita

texts.en:
68-year-old Dionesita P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Dionesita raises livestock. The income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Dionesita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and she earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

Dionesita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dionesita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds and vitamins. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Nghiêm's Group

texts.en:

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. In 2009, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by C. from SEDA. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ làm tóc & làm đẹp cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND.  Vào 2009, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.
Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:
1.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.
Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
"Virginia C. is a 55-year old widow who lives in Purok Starapple, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She supports her family by operating a business of buying and selling dried fish. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dried fish business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8000. Virginia is requesting a loan of PHP 21000 so she can purchase more stock for sale. Her photograph was taken during the center meeting because the stock of dried fish was already sent to buyers early in the morning.

This will be her new loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Virginia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and insure their future well being, by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of dried fish for sale

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor J. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. He is 52 years old. Nestor is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nestor plants and harvests rice for sale. Nestor has been engaged in his business for over 31 years and earns approximately 7,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Nestor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Nestor is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Nestor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20201020016) is a 53 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, H. owns & operates food stall, selling rice products in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3.600.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by H. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador A., 59 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Dominador raises crops.  The main source of income for his business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dominador has children who still go to school. He is working hard to sustain their education and have them finish college.

Dominador joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominador has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Dominador is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch R. is a hard working man who makes his living by weaving baskets with his wife at home. This couple has seven children, four of whom are single and the rest are married.  Of all his children, three are work at different jobs to share his responsibility of supporting the entire family’s needs. 

Touch R. and his wife go through the village looking for bamboo and take it home and soak it in water for almost a week.  The bamboo is then dried in the sun for three days. Touch and his wife then split the bamboo into smaller pieces and weave them into baskets.  Touch R. is taking a loan to invest in his handicraft business, to buy some baskets for sale.

loans.use: To buy some baskets for sale

loans.name: Paul Kamau

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Naivasha, maiella area for the last seven years. He is 43 years old, married to Ruth Nyambura, and they have two school going children. He learned about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Niavasha, Maiella area. This will be his fourth loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES 50,000 in full and on time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings, fertilizers and to employ manpower for the farm labour.

In the future, Paul hopes to increase his farm production by acquiring farming machines (e.g. tractors).

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizers and to employ labourers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 46 years old and married. She has 4 children aged 20, 19, 15 and 13. Elizabeth is challenged to sustain her children's education since all four of them go to school. 

Elizabeth is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to the market. Elizabeth has been farming for quite some time now. She says her farm helps her family a lot and she hopes to expand her business. 

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Weaving baskets is a core job Say V. pursues to earn daily income. She always spends at least eight hours per day doing this work. Say V. has six children, and all of them are single. Say V. has two kids who can generate income with her by working in a rubber farm in Kompong Cham Province. 

Say V. and her husband save up over 10 sets of basket and then sell them to their customers to earn their living. Generally, her valued customers need to order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband helps her transport the finished products directly to customers' houses. 

Recently, Say V. has run out of raw materials from her stock, so she would like a Kiva loan in order to buy additional bamboo to make baskets for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional bamboo to make baskets to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 47 years old. Emma is married and has one 12-year-old child. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino J. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. He is 42 years old. Marcelino is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Marcelino owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marcelino has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marcelino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 32,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Marcelino is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Marcelino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia T. is a married woman who lives in Purok Bangkal, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating one business venture: fishing / fish vending  business.  Her husband Victorio T., who is 49 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 3 to 24 years old. 

Dionesia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Dionesia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 26,000 which she intends to use to purchase fishing equipment and do repairs on her fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for the future and cover their daily needs.  Dionesia T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward  the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Repair of fishing boat and purchase of fishing gear

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Мингбоева Ситора проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 26 лет. Она мать двоих детей. Образование среднее. Муж находится на заработках в России. После отъезда мужа занялась бизнесом. Она работает на рынке Дехкон. Арендует торговую точку, где продает мужские шапки и полотенце. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Она намерена привезти товар с города Душанбе.
texts.en: Sitora M. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 26 years old and the mother of two children.  She has a high school education.  Her husband is working in Russia.  She began this business after her husband left.  She works in the Dehkon market.  She rents a shop where she sells men's hats and towels. She has already been doing this work for two years.  She is taking out a loan to increase her sales.  She intends to bring in goods from the city of Dushanbe.

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
48-year-old Esterlita A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has three children aged 22, 17 and 15. To make a living, Esterlita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale.

Esterlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: a food vending business. She lives in Purok Dalisay, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

 By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.  Juliet is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase raw materials.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Juliet aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  Her photo was taken during the center meeting because all of her food was already sold out.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for business

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Pan M., age 30, lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. She now makes her living by selling Khmer cake to her neighbors and in other villages. She has a life partner in her husband who is a chicken seller around his community. This couple is blessed with two children; both of them are single and still attending school.

Pan M. currently generates an income of approximately $1 per day by selling Khmer cake. In her family, selling chickens is the main revenue for the household. That is the reason why Pan M. is seeking a loan for her husband to buy extra chickens to sell.

loans.use: To buy extra chickens to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa B. is a married woman who lives in Purok Bangkal, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: dried fish vending and fishing businesses.  Her husband Jose B., who is 51 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are 7 to 29 years old. 

 Narcisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Narcisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and sustain their daily needs. 

Narcisa B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna C. (in the photo) is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Try Porm is 45 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1995 and have five children--three sons and two daughters. Try climbs palm trees to collect palm juice. Vanna is a weaver and produces palm sugar. She is asking for a loan of $200 to use for producing palm sugar. 

She will use the loan to purchase new materials: a bamboo container for sugar palm juice and a frying pan in which palm juice is boiled.

loans.use: To produce palm sugar

loans.name: Dan Mo 1-4 Group

texts.en:
Dich T. N. is 57 years old. She has two children. Both of them have jobs. Mrs Dich is living in Dan Mo village, Uy No commune, Dong Anh. She is a farmer. She grows rice and vegetables. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She is the leader of a 5-member group loan in SEDA. The last cycle, she borrowed 4,142,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5.,014,000 VND to invest in agriculture.

 About the other borrowers in her group:

 Hien T. N. is 52 years old. She raises ducks and fish. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for them.

 Phuong T. N. is 35 years old. She buys and sells  scrap iron. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND for her small business.

 Tam T. N. is 42 years old. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for chickens.

 Thuy T. V. is 30 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreytouch C. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Kimhoun Hong, have been married since 1998 and have four children--one son and three daughters. The family lives on an island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sreytouch used to be a weaver, but she quit the business and started a new business as well. She now works in a garment factory. She is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario D. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: buying & selling dried coconut. She lives in Brgy. Bagacay, Sibonga, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her buying & selling dried coconut business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.  Rosario is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Rosario aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to use as working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 34 years old. Jocelyn is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 5. 

Jocelyn is engaged in farming. She particularly plants and harvests rice crops. She sells her harvest on the market. Jocelyn also grows pigs for fattening and sale. She works hard to be able to sustain her family. She hopes to have a stable business and income.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to buy farm supplies and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pig feed

loans.name: Usoss

texts.en:
Mr. Usoss T., 36 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Rim Vorng, 24 years old (pictured together), have been married since 2007. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Usoss has been driving a "Tuk Tuk" taxi for almost five years. He also fishes when he is free. His wife stays at home because she just delivered a baby. 

Usos is asking for his first loan of $700 to repair his fishing gear.

loans.use: To repair his fishing gear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase veterinary medicines and supplies

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn T. (in the photo), 38, is a widow with three sons and two daughters. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 


Yorn is a rice farmer, and she slso sells steamed corn when she is not busy at her farm. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina A. is a married woman who lives in Prk.Tikoy, Brgy. Bogo, Argao, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  abaca weaving and Ready-to-Wear clothes businesses.  Her husband Modesto A., who is 65 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 34 to 42 years old.  

Florentina  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florentina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 27,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 which she intends to use as additional business capital so that she can continue to save up for the future.  

Florentina  A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry C. (in the photo) is 31 years old and her husband, Mr. Vanna Un is 33 years old. They live along National Road Number Five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1996 and have four children--one son and three daughters. 

Ry grows lotus plants and sells them at Phnom Penh market. She hopes to supplement this with a new business selling rice, but she does not have enough capital. Hence she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to launch the business.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: a  fish vending  business. She lives in Brgy. Calumpang, Oslob, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her fish vending  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.  Vilma is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Vilma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

 About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: working capital for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao P. is 47 years old and his wife, Leng Yory, is 35. They work from home, making furniture which they also sell. Most of their output consists of beds and tables, which they accumulate and sell as sets. Their furniture is made mostly from wood. The couple has eight children, seven of whom are still single. When school ends for the day, they help their parents make furniture. 

This family can earn a profit on average of $7.50 per day to cover the family’s daily expenses. Sao P. is concerned that his house is getting old, and it needs repair. Sao P. and his family have been living there for long time, and they have never repaired it yet. A few parts are broken, and it is not comfortable for his family. So Sao P. would like a loan to buy some materials to repair the broken parts of his house.

loans.use: To buy some materials to repair the broken part of his house

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Mr. Tea S. (in the photo) is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Daney Lorn is 35 years old. They have been married since 1995 and have two daughters. One is a garment factory worker and another one attends school. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Tea is a farmer. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and married with three children, all of whom are dependent on her and need her support. Rose lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines.  Her husband works long hours as a fisherman to support the family.  To supply additional income, Rose wants to expand the family fishing business through additional working capital. 

Rose would like to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fish nets, rope, and additional materials.  With additional equipment, Rose believes that her fish supply will increase, bringing higher revenue.

Over the course of her membership, Rose has achieved strong performance with regular attendance at group meetings and steady repayments.  Rose is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. 

With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that their expanded business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund all of her children’s college education.

loans.use: To purchase fish nets, rope, and additional materials needed in her fishing business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma N. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Daanglungsod, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a pig fattening business. Her husband Hipolito N., who is 49 years old, works as a tricycle (three-wheeled transport) driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 3 to 16 years old.  

Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future, support the family and do house repairs.  Gemma N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny S. and her husband, Mr. Samnang Pouk, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2007 and have one son. Ny is a weaver, a skill she learned after her marriage and Samnang is a farmer. Ny is asking for a loan of $250 to provide capital for her husband’s farm and for her weaving business.

loans.use: To provide capital for her husband’s farm.

loans.name: Lutengo Development Group B-Mukono

texts.en:
36-year-old Joseph W. makes common cause with Lutengo Development group B-Mukono. A decade is the period of time he has been running his charcoal, firewood and beef sales businesses in Lutengo-Mukono. Credit for the setting up of this business, he says, goes to his father who, he says, offered him not only financial support but also moral support. Prior to that, his efforts were more concentrated on a shoe sales business. 

The longevity and stability in his business operations, he says, all boils down to two factors: diligence and a determined sense of purpose. Joseph is happily married with two children. Weekly, he says, these businesses generate shillings 100,000. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more bags of charcoal and more firewood to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of charcoal and firewood for resale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling fish and other foods and running a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Prk. Bulasa, Brgy. Balisong, Argao, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP6,500.  

Jocelyn is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase more inventory. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. She aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Nenkuyoto  Ene

texts.en:
For the last eight years Nenkuyoto has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town. She is 27 years old, married to T. K., and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep and 10 goats which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Nenkuyoto aspires to become the leading supplier of livestock in Naivasha town

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep and 10 goats which she will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia M. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Talusan, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish.  Her husband, Celso M., who is 53 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 11 children between 5 and 29 years old.  Four of them have their own families, two are working and two are currently in school. 

Artemia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Artemia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future, educate their children and sustain their daily needs. Artemia M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.
