loans.name: Samuel Githinji

texts.en:
Samuel   has been in the mining business for the last six years in Ndunyu Njeru town. He is 42 years old and married to Rachel Wangui. They are blessed with four schooling children.

He got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru town. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to pay to lease land and cater for the labour.

In future, Samuel hopes to expand his business outside Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To pay to lease land and cater for the labour

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta  R. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Obo, Dalaguete, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating one business venture: buying and selling vegetables. Her husband Maximiano R., who is 49 years old, works as a motorcycle driver ("habal-habal") to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 10 to 23 years old.  

Restituta  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Restituta  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use as additional business capital so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children.  

Restituta  R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: buying and selling vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate A. is 29 years old, single, and her place of residence is Eldoret-Kenya. She sells used clothes, has been in this business for two years, and earns a monthly profit of KES.20,000.


Emmaculate learnt about KADET LTD through a credit officer and so she is applying for her second loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD,after paying back the previous loan well and on time. She intends to buy four bales of second-hand clothes to sell during the festive season as the demand is very high. With the anticipated profits she plans to expand her boutique.


In future Emmaculate wishes to open another branch in Eldoret town.

loans.use: To buy four bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald M. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Ronald has a garment shop, which he has run for less than a year.
To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 1,800,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Ronald hopes to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. In the future, Ronald hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Kugonza

texts.en:
Kugonza J. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. J. has a stationery business, which he has run for less than a year.  
To help expand his business, J. has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stationery items. With the help of his loan from BRAC, J. hopes to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. In the future, J. hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery items

loans.name: Uon

texts.en: Uon

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Erabu

texts.en:
K. Erabu is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Erabu has a bar business, which she has run for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Erabu has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks and also to set up a retail shop. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Erabu hopes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Erabu hopes to own a retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks for her bar and set up a retail shop

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
R. Steven is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Steven has a retail shop business, which he has run for four years.
To help expand his business, Steven has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and rice. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Steven hopes to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. In the future, Steven hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and rice for resale

loans.name: Adjo Emilie

texts.fr: Emilie a 35 ans et est mariée. Elle habite quartier Kluvi et exerce comme activité la vente d’alimentation générale et les bassines.  En effet, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite sur le boulevard Houphouët Boigny. Elle compte dans cette activité 10 ans d'expérience. Pour accroitre son commerce et répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante, elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Emilie is 35 years old and married. She lives in the Kluvi district. She sells general grocery items and basins. She gets her supplies from the big market in Lomé and then sells them on the Houphouët Boigny Boulevard. She has 10 years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business and and meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase food products and basins

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Being a good mother, 38-year-old Mercedita is very concerned about the lives of her three children who still live with her and are dependent on her.

Instead of allowing herself to be trapped in the midst of insecurities, Mercedita joined a KIVA field partner in the Philippines, ASHI, to be able to access loans which will enable her to be productive and flourish. 

Through previous loans, she has supported her fishing business. Profits she will be getting will augment her husband’s income and as soon as they grow, she will be able to support her children’s education until they finish college and provide other needs in order to enjoy the gift of life.  Moreover, her role as a mother will be happy. 

Her membership in ASHI and the loans she has accessed since she became a member have assisted her in operating a business. Because of this, Mercedita has been performing very well in her repayment, attendance, and business thus making her qualified for a higher loan amount.

loans.use: To continue fishing business and expand it

loans.name: Kayitesi

texts.fr: Kayitesi  B. a 47 ans, elle est célibataire, et elle a 1 enfant qui a 16ans, qui va à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les matériels pour la construction et 2 lavabos, payement des impôts, et pour acheter les peintures.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance et d’acheter de bon matériel, et rembourser ce crédit à temps envie de solliciter une autre, et s’augmenter son affaire.  Elle voudrait bâtir beaucoup de maisons, avoir les locataires, et réaliser de l’argent en s’autofinançant elle-même.  Elle voudrait aussi le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kayitesi B. is 47 years old. She is single, and has a 16-year-old child who attends school. 

She plans to use her loan to buy construction materials, two sinks and some paint, and to pay her taxes. 

Her growth strategy is to acquire good materials and repay the loan on time to be able to seek another and expand her business. 

She wants to build many houses, have tenants, and make money by self-financing her activities. She also wishes to ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials, two sinks, and paint; paying taxes

loans.name: Snave

texts.fr: Snave K. G. a 30 ans, il est célibataire, et il est fini 2 ans de l’université.  Il est né à Goma, dans le DRC, mais maintenant il habite à Kigali.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’aide familiale.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner pour devenir indépendant financièrement, et minimiser sa consommation pour élever son épargne.  Il voudrait avoir un nouvel emploi, et bien rémunérer après avoir terminé ses études.  Pour la vie, il voudrait terminer ses études, et se marier.
texts.en:
Snave K. G. is 30 years old and single. He has been in university for two years. He was born in Goma, in the DRC, but now lives in Kigali. 

He will use his loan to support himself as a home-health aide. His growth strategy is to accumulate savings that will allow him to become financially independent, and to reduce his expenses to increase his savings. 

Once he has completed his studies, he wants to find new employment that pays well. For the future, his plans are to finish school and get married.

loans.use: Home-health aide

loans.name: Bayar

texts.en:
Bayar H. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All of his five children attend a local high school. 

Bayar operates a livestock trading business in his province with help of his wife. He purchases livestock from herders at wholesale prices and his wife sells their meat at the local market after slaughtering them. They have been engaged this business for the past four years and have built up a stable and successful operation over the years. 

Today his working capital has exceeded 1,000,000 MNT. Bayar is a sensitive and well-informed decision-maker and says, " My dream is to one day have my own shop in the local market." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock and meat at wholesale price from the countryside.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock and meat at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nasridin

texts.en:
A. Nasridin is a 63-year-old farmer. He grows potatoes, cabbages and wheat and also breeds cattle to support his family. His sons help him with the business. Nasridin came from a family of farmers and through farming he is able to build the future of his children. He started cultivating their small parcel of land 15 years ago. His harvest is intended for family consumption and the remainder is sold in the market. 

Currently Nasridin is asking for a loan of 11,000 Somoni that will be used for the purchase high quality seeds and fertilizer for his crop. With the part of the loan he will also purchase calves. He and his family sincerely thank Kiva and its lenders.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer and calves

loans.name: Sylvend

texts.fr: Sylvend K. est agriculteur de canne à sucre.  Il a 46 ans, il est marié, et il a 5 enfants entre 1 an et 16 ans.  Il a une éducation primaire, et 3 de ses enfants vont a l’école.    Il va utiliser son prêt pour l travail de cultiver les cannes a sucre, et payer la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir la modernisation dans la plantation des cannes à sucre, et augmenter la main d’œuvre des cultivateurs pour avoir une bonne récolte.  Il voudrait élever la récolte de canne a sucre au maximum possible, et se mettent ensemble, étant comme des cultivateurs des canne a sucre pour cherche d’autre marché des canne a sucre.  Pour la famille et la vie, il voudrait assurer le bien être de sa famille, scolarise les enfants en payant les frais scolaires, épargner de scolariser les enfants, et habiter dans un endroit confortable.
texts.en:
Sylvend K. is a sugar cane farmer. He is 46 years old, married and has 5 children between the ages of 1 and 16 years. He has a primary education, and 3 of his children attend school.

Sylvend is going to use his loan for the work of growing sugar cane and paying the labor costs. His strategy for the growth of his business is to modernize the sugar cane plantation and expand the farming workforce in order to have a good harvest. He would like to increase the sugar cane harvest as much as possible and get together with the sugar cane farmers in order to seek out other sugar cane markets.

For his family and his life, Sylvend would like to assure the well-being of his family, educate his children by paying their educational fees, save to send the children to school and live in a comfortable place.

loans.use: The work of farming sugar cane, paying labor costs

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
A. Juma is 53 years old and married with one child. He has been a farmer for 17 years, an activity he undertook after having his child. However, Juma has always taken pleasure from working the land and now particularly enjoys cultivating potato, carrot and wheat. Although his crops are annual, they are very profitable, and during the season they are very much in demand in large quantities. For this reason, Juma cares for his crop carefully so he can benefit from a good harvest. He also mentions that it is difficult sowing the plants and protecting them from insect infestation. This is his seventh loan with IMON International. Juma will invest the funds he requests into purchasing seeds and fertilizers for his farmlands.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
 
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Hairat

texts.en: Hairat H. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and son in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His only son, age 3, is in a local kindergarten. Hairat operates a meat trading business in his province with the help of his wife. He purchases livestock from herders at a wholesale price and his wife sells the meat at the local market after slaughtering the livestock. They have been engaged in this business for the past four years and have built a stable and successful operation over the years. Today, his working capital has exceeded 500,000 MNT. He plans to increase his working capital during the period of preparing meat for the winter. Hairat says, " I want to expand my business and buy my own car in the future." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy more meat at wholesale

loans.name: Gulchira

texts.ru: Галимова Гульчира жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 50 лет. Замужем. Имеет 5-ых детей. Муж находится в России. Сама Гульчира более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает материалы. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. То есть она хочет купить в оптом материалы.
texts.en: Gulchira G. is a resident of Tursun-zoda.  She is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Her  husband is working in Russia.  Gulchira has been working in sales for more than ten years.  She rents a shop where she sells fabric.  She is taking out a loan to increase her sales.  She wants to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Bozor

texts.en:
Bozor is married and has three children. He owns a small store that sells spare parts for cars. His business is located close to a car maintenance shop. This gives him an opportunity to have many repeat clients and a stable business. Bozor has been in this business for four years. During this time, he has developed a good business network that supplies him with the parts his clients order. Bozor would like to borrow 3,000 USD to purchase spare parts in bulk. Bozor and his family sincerely thank all Kiva lenders for support.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars

loans.name: Ami Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène a 33 ans et est mariée. Elle a en charge 5 enfants. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle fait  comme activité la vente de bijoux et chaussures pour arriver à aider son mari au foyer. Elle compte déjà 3 ans et s’approvisionne au Bénin à Cotonou et au grand de Lomé. Elle revend ensuite ses marchandises à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite au près de WAGES un prêt pour faire  face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Hélène is 33 years old. She is married and has five children in her care. To improve her children’s life conditions, she sells jewelry and shoes, in order to help her husband with family expense. She has three years of experience already and stocks up in Benin in Cotonou and at the big [market] of Lomé. She then resells her wares in front of her home. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to meet ever increasing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchasing jewelry and shoes

loans.name: Muhammadi

texts.en:
K. Muhammadi is a caring and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, he has been around people who make a living raising animals -- and thanks to this knowledge, he has dedicated himself to raising and selling cattle, a skill that he learned from his parents. With experience gained over time from buying and selling these animals, he has been able to bring stability to his family. Now he would like to increase his supply of capital in order to acquire more cattle. To make this possible, he has applied for a loan for 5000 Somoni to buy more cattle, and thereby increase the well being and security of his family.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more cattle

loans.name: Nandiwè

texts.fr: Nandiwè est mariée et a 2 enfants. Elle a 32 ans. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle exerce comme activité la vente des épices. Elle est née à Sotouboua au nord du pays et vit à adidogomé où elle exerce son activité. Elle cumule 8 ans dans cette activité et achète au grand marché de Lomé. Pour accroitre son commerce, elle demande un crédit.
texts.en:
Nandiwè is married and has 2 children. She is 32 years old. To contributive to the household, she sell spices. 

She was born in Sotouboua and lives in  Adidogomé, where she carries out her activity. She has been selling spices for 8 years and buys them at the grand market in Lomé. In order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: To buy spices

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.en:
Safarbek is married, has four children and makes a living as a businessman in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan, selling auto accessories and spare parts in a local car market. His business, which is eight years old, is flourishing as more and more Tajiks buy vehicles, and the items he sells are always in high demand. To take advantage of this demand, he is applying for a loan for $3,000 to buy more items to sell to his customers. His goals are to maintain his leading position in the market and continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars to sell to his customers

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi S. lives in the town of Kurgantyube in Southern Tajikistan. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are in school, which means that they have to spend a lot of money on education. Bibi makes a living by raising cows, and has applied to borrow 5000 Somoni to buy more of them to raise. Her goals are to increase her income and thereby cover all her dear children's expenses.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her income by buying more cattle

loans.name: Munojotkhon

texts.ru: Тагаева Муночотхон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж находится в России. Сама Муночотхон более семи лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном продает одежду и разную мелочь. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента, то есть она хочет закупить сезонный товар.
texts.en: Munojotkhon T. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 37 years old, married, has five children. Her husband is working in Russia.  Munojotkhon has been working in sales for more than seven years. She principally sells clothes and different odds and ends.  She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of her inventory by buying seasonal goods.

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Isroil

texts.en:
G. Isroil is 54 years old and lives with his wife and six children. He has been a farmer for 17 years, ever since his marriage. His job allows him to support his family, and this is why he works so hard and with such determination. He grows onions and wheat, and he is committed to produce a high-quality crop. In general, his output is in high demand, but he spends a lot of money on the fertilizers that are necessary for good yield. This is Isroil’s first loan through IMON International, and he plans to use it to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricant

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.en:
R. Abdukarim is 44 years old, married and has four children. He makes a living by selling cattle and providing transportation services. As a rule, he buys young cattle in the central market, feeds them and than resells them for a higher price in a local market. Because he has been in this business for five years, he knows a lot about which animals to choose, the best ways to breed them and how to care for them. His work requires him to get up early every morning in order to feed his animals and look after them, but it also allows him to generate an ample and stable income for his large family. Abdukarim knows that the price of cattle is low now but believes it will increase in the future, which is why he has applied for this loan, for $3,000, to enlarge his herd. He and his family deeply appreciate the trust and support given to them by Kiva lenders.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his business by buying cattle.

loans.name: Daniel Mwania

texts.en:
Daniel, age 35, is married to Joyce. They have four children, ages 6, 8, 10, and 12. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells various food items like bread, cereals, sugar, milk, and many others. He sells items in small quantities.  

Daniel was introduced to Kadet through a public awareness effort organized by the local chief. He has been running this business for 10 years. He intends to use this loan to buy more cereals, cooking oil, flour, and other items. If the loan improves the business, he will pay school fees for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, and cereals

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Suhrob J. supports his wife and his two children by driving a taxi in the Southern Tajikistan city of Tursunzade. He has been driving a taxi for approximately two years. Suhrob has a good reputation among his fellow taxi drivers. He works hard and is a positive influence on others. Suhrob requested a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase necessary spare parts for his car for maintenance. We are happy for the opportunity to help him improve his business and position himself for a successful future.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for car repair

loans.name: Salima

texts.fr: Elle a 34 ans et est mariée. Elle a en charge 2 enfants. Pour arriver à aider son mari au foyer, elle fait la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle compte déjà dans cette activité 10 ans et achète au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite, elle revend au marché d’Agoè où elle tire  assez de bénéfice. Elle est  née au Bénin mais exerce son activité au Togo à Lomé quartier Agoè. L’objet de ce crédit sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de 10 sacs de riz.
texts.en:
Salima is 34 years old and is married. She has 2 children in her care. To be able to help her husband with household expenses, she sells general food products. She has been involved in this activity for 10 years, and she buys her products at the grand market in Lomé. Then she re-sells the food at the Agoè market, where she makes a good profit. 

Salima was born in Benin but works in Togo, in the  Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. The loan will mostly be used to buy 10 sacks of rice.

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi B. M. is 42 years old, married and has five children between the ages of two and 22.  His business is located at Changamwe estate in Mombasa,Kenya, which is the coastal region of Kenya and well known for its many tourist attractions as well as the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He owns a hardware store in which he sells such items as lubricants and paints to the local residents.  He has been in this business for the last three years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is financial constraints. He works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy more paints and lubricants to expand his business. He hopes to own a big yard where he will locate a bigger business. He describes himself as a very determined and focused man.

loans.use: To purchase paints and lubricants

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
B. Halima is 48 years old and married with six children. Halima has run her business for 20 years. With the assistance of her daughters, she fries and bakes pastries and meat patties and sells them in a small snack-bar. Halima and her daughters are very nice, polite people which brings them a good clientele. The business generates income to support the family. Today Halima requests 5000 Somoni in order to buy plates and dishes for her business. Halima has gained a reputation for responsibility with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing plates and dishes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Ramatouma

texts.fr: Ramatou est mariée et a 3 enfants.   Elle a 32 ans et exerce comme activité la vente de Bazins et Boubou. Elle  exerce cette activité il y a de cela 4 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Mali à Bamako   et revend ensuite à  La devanture de sa maison.  Elle demande un prêt pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Ramatou is married and has 3 children. She is 32 years old, and sells damask cloth and "boubous" (African robes). She has been involved in this activity for 4 years. She obtains her supplies in Bamako, Mali, and re-sells the products in front of her house. She is asking for a loan in order to satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy damask cloth and "boubous"

loans.name: Pascal Nzioki

texts.en:
Pascal, age 38, is married and together he and his wife have four children, between the ages of five and eight years old. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells cereals, detergent, flour, milk, and other foodstuffs. Pascal was introduced to Kadet by a friend who was already a member. Pascal has been running this business for 11 years .With this loan, he plans to add more stock to the shop and and also invest in livestock trading. 

With the proceeds of this loan, he intends to diversify his business and improve the lives of his family members.

loans.use: buy more stock for Kshs 20,000 and invest in livestock trading for Kshs 10,000

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma B. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 53 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Norma has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 33 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Teresia Mugure

texts.en:
For the last 10 years Teresia has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town. She is 38 years old and married to Peter T.. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid her previous loans of KES 80,000 in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizers, seedlings and cater for the farm labour.

In the future, Teresia aspires to venture into large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings and cater for the farm labour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Revocate

texts.en:
K. Revocate is 46 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Revocate has a retail shop business, which she has run for five years. She also does outside catering.
To help expand her business, Revocate has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Revocate hopes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Revocate hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Gratien

texts.fr: Gratien H. est marié, et il a 2 enfants entre 8 ans et 13 ans.  Il a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter du ciment, sable, et planches pour la construction.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner pour augmenter l’activité.  Il voudrait avoir une maison, et la réhabiliter.
texts.en: Gratien H. is married and has 2 children, 8 and 13 years old. He has an elementary school education and all his children go to school. He will use his loan to buy construction supplies: cement, sand, and boards. His growth strategy is to save in order to expand his business. He would like to have a house and rehabilitate it.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies: cement, sand and boards

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María pertenece al banco comunal “Avanzando Juntas” de la ciudad de Talca. Ella tiene un puesto de  comida rápida, desde hace 9 años, ubicado en el patio delantero de su casa. Sus principales productos de venta son: hot dogs, churrascos, sopaipillas y empanadas. Atiende todos los días de la semana, de 17:30 hrs. a 1:00 hrs. 
Con este préstamo comprará cerámica para el suelo de su negocio, una batidora y también ingredientes para cocinar, como por ejemplo: harina, vienesas, mayonesa, pan, etc. Su sueño es ampliar el espacio de su negocio e incluir mesas para que sus clientes puedan comer en el mismo lugar. 
María es el único sustento económico de su hogar, ya que vive sola con su única hija de 12 años.
María está muy agradecida del apoyo económico que han sido para ella y su negocio, los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza. Además, participar en las reuniones junto a sus compañeros le ha ayudado anímicamente. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. La mayor parte de la población habita en el sector rural y se dedica principalmente a las actividades económicas propias del campo. Se caracteriza  por su hermosa artesanía y arquitectura colonial. Sus principales atracciones dicen relación con la producción vitivinícola.
texts.en:
María belongs to the “Avanzando Juntas” (Moving Forward Together) community bank in the city of Talca.  For the past nine years she has a fast-food stall located out the front of her house.  The main products she sells are: hot dogs, barbecued meat, 'sopaipillas' (fried pastries) and empanadas (stuffed pastries).  She serves in her business every day of the week from 5.30pm to 1.00am.

She will use this loan to buy tiles for the floor of her business, a mixer and also cooking ingredients such as flour, hot dogs, mayonnaise, bread, etc.  Her dream is to extend her business space and include tables so that her customers can eat there.

María provides the only economic support for her household since she lives alone with her  12 year-old daughter.  María is very grateful for the financial support that she has received through Fondo Esperanza's loans.  She also tells us that participating in her community bank meetings together with her fellow members has helped give her encouragement.

Talca is in Maule region, in the center of the country.  Most of its residents live in the rural area and mainly engage in farming activities.  Talca is noted for its beautiful handicrafts and colonial architecture.  Its main attractions are related to the area's wine production.

loans.use: To buy tiles and food

loans.name: Ramathan

texts.en:
T. Ramathan is 25 years old and lives in the town of Masidi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is single and has one child, who is currently in school. Ramathan has a retail shop business, which he has run for a year. He also owns a motorcycle business.
To help expand his business, Ramathan has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar, soap and rice. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Ramathan hopes to generate greater profits and pay his child's school fees. In the future, Ramathan hopes to change his business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, soap and rice

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony, age 29, is married to Rhoda and together they have one child who is two years. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells foodstuffs  like cooking oil, flour, etc. Antony was introduced to Kadet by a friend who was already a member. Antony has been running this business for three years. With this loan, he intends to buy more stock for his shop. 

He hopes to be a self-reliant businessman and support his family better.

loans.use: to buy cereals, flour, maize, detergent, and other products for the shop.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
N. Christine is 50 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Christine has a bar, which she has run for two years. She also owns rental houses.
To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Christine hopes to own a depot shop.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est mariée et a en charge 3 enfants.  Elle a 46 ans.  Pour pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges, elle fait la vente de pagne. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite au marché d’Agbalépédo où elle habite. Elle compte dans cette activité 5 ans d’expérience. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter de nouveaux lots de pagnes.
texts.en:
Akoko is married with three children in her care. She is 46 years old. She sells pagnes (brightly printed West-African cloth) to help her husband with the family expenses. 

She gets her stocks at the big market of Lomé for resale at the market of Agbalépédo, where she lives. She has five years of experience in this activity. 

She is seeking a loan to increase her stock of pagnes.

loans.use: Purchase of pagnes

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella B. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Stella has a garment shop business, which she has run for ten years. She also owns rental houses.
To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Stella hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard G. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. Richard has a dairy farm business, which he has run for ten years. He also owns a motorcycle transport business.
To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more milk. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Richard hopes to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. In the future, Richard hopes to own rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase more milk

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet K. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Harriet has a furniture workshop/carpentry business, which she has run for five years. She is also a salary earner. 
To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Harriet hopes to expand her workshop further.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Akou Elise

texts.fr: Elise a 3 enfants en charge et est mariée à un enseignant de profession. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est née à Lomé et habite quartier Agoè.   Elle exerce comme activité la boulangerie et cumule 5 ans dans cette activité. Pour avoir les produits nécessaires de fabrication, elle les procure au grand marché de Lomé et redistribue ensuite les pains  à son domicile.  Elle demande un crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de farine de blé et 10 sacs de sucre.
texts.en: Elise has three children in her care; she is married to a teacher and is 38 years old.  She was born in Lomé and now lives in the Agoè quarter. She runs a bakery and has five years' experience in this field. She sources her raw materials from the large market in Lomé and sells her bread from home. She is seeking a loan to buy ten bags of flour and ten bags of sugar.

loans.use: Purchase of flour and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Cyrus  Wakaigua

texts.en:
Cyrus is 52 years old and married to Veronica Wambui who contributes to the family income. They have children aged 30, 27, 22,18 and 16 years. He has a welding and metal fabrication workshop which he has been running for 10 years with an income of about 17,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan from Kadet with which he wants to buy metal for making burglar-proof doors for sale. He hopes to expand the business, start a manufacturing company, and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: Buy metal for making burglar-proof doors

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar, milk, rice, oil, etc

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married woman with four children. Three of her children attend school and one is still too young. Zena owns a house without has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past three months, Zena has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and other customers. In addition, she is also a farmer, which adds to her income. Zena’s major business challenge is the season, as during the rainy season it is difficult to get fish to sell. 

Zena decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase two deep freezers to store fish. In the future, Zena hopes to establish a permanent market stall and supply fish to hotels.

loans.use: to purchase deep freezers to store fish

loans.name: Ngandu Kisombya Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
40-year-old N. Annet has for the last 11 years been engaged in a modest pig husbandry business in Ngandu-Mukono. Apprentice training at a friend's farm in many respects is where she got the skills and knowledge about this business. 

Annet, who is happily married with four children, says her side business raising poultry has been of paramount importance, especially as regards the addition to her profits. What has brought success to pass in her operations however, has been her hard work and devotion. Weekly her profits are to the tune of shillings 70,000 and with this loan, she says she is going to buy more piglets to raise and at length resell when they grow.

loans.use: The purchase of piglets

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For over twenty-five years, Fatuma has operated a retail shop. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Fatuma is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase beans, rice, and washing detergent to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. In the future, Fauma hopes to establish a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, and washing detergent

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with two children, neither of whom goes to school. She also takes care of her niece and nephew.  Patricia lives in a rented house with access to electricity, but without running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food. 

For the past six years, Patricia has operated a retail shop where she works six days a week. Her main business challenges are the change of seasons and thieves. Patricia is requesting a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to purchase bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. Patricia’s goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Benjamin Kipsang

texts.en:
Benjamin Kipsang K. is a 35-year-old business man who sells petrol to his customers at a profit. He is married to Rael K., and they have three children who are six, four and one year old. He runs his business in Kemco Eldoret, Kenya and has been in this business for about six years.

Benjamin was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he has no other history with any MFI. He is applying for his first loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more petrol.

He hopes to operate a large petrol station, so that he can supply paraffin, diesel and petrol to his customers and in the future extend the same services to the entire town of Eldoret.

loans.use: To purchase more petrol

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has ten children, two of whom are in school. Teddy also takes care of additional relatives. She lives in a home with electricity and running water. Teddy’s major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and medication. 

For the past twenty years, Teddy has operated a charcoal-selling business. She works seven days a week, selling her product from home. She also generates additional income from renting rooms. Teddy has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her business goals and aspirations include owning a delivery van and selling only wholesale.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman with six children. Five of her children attend school, while one is still too young. Biasha owns a house without electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and other customers. In addition, Biasha also sells firewood to contribute to her income. Biasha’s major business challenge is the season, as during the rainy season it is difficult to get fish to sell. 

Biasha decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to purchase thirty kilograms of fish and a refrigerator for preserving fresh fish. In the future, Biasha hopes to establish a seafood market stall.

loans.use: to purchase fish and a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He has over eight years of experience working with a pick-up. He works on a freelance basis, offering delivery service upon the request of his clients. He delivers furniture, used items, etc. His business income is vital to pay for his two children's schooling and to meet their needs. He is the main income provider for the family; his wife is a housewife. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to perform maintenance needed on the van, which is in bad condition, especially before the coming winter season. He hopes that with the help of this loan, he will do his work properly and earn a good income for his relatives.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has two adult children. She sells clothing at the central market in the town of Nova Kahovka. Valentina started this business eighteen years ago when she did not have any other opportunities for making a living. She was courageous enough to start her business with very little money and almost no experience. However, little by little, she began to gain customers as well as sales experience. Today, Valentina enjoys her business and it has become a stable source of income. 

Valentina has used micro loans before and found them very helpful for her business. This time, she is requesting 9,000 UAH to increase the assortment of clothing in her shop. Valentina hopes to earn additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase clothing assortment

loans.name: Timothy Olindo

texts.en:
Timothy Olindo I. is a hardworking man of 37 years, married to Janet Ikapyan. Together they have three children aged 10 years, 6 years and 3 years. He has been keeping poultry for the past three years and he earns a monthly income of KES. 35,000.

He learned about KADET LTD through marketing. He has no history with any other Microfinance Institution. He has applied for his third loan of KES. 83,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy poultry feed and more poultry to keep so that he will have more eggs to sell to his customers. He plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start Dairy farming.

Timothy hopes to grow his business and become the leading local investor in Lumakanda Eldoret-Kenya.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and more poultry.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty N. lives in Ndeeba, in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children who are in school. She also takes care of her father.   Resty's business is a bar. She has been in this business for ten years and she works seven days a week. Resty sells her products by retail in a shop.  Resty has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings which she will use to buy more crates of beer and local gin to sell. Her main business challenges are the rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling by wholesale only and also to build her own house. Resty lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and local gin to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man and the father of two young children still attending primary school. He is an experienced carpenter, who has owned his shop for almost 15 years. He works very hard because he is the main income provider and he is responsible for two young children. As he says, he wants to offer the best life for them. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a wood-sanding machine in order to expand his business operation. In the future, he hopes to conduct his work properly and continue the development of his business.

loans.use: To purchase a wood-sanding machine

loans.name: Janet Ambogo

texts.en:
Janet Ambogo I. is 51 years old, married to Nixon Esendi. They have three children aged 30,28 and 18 years, and live in Lumakanda Eldoret town. She makes food warmer baskets and has been in this business for the past twelve years with a monthly profit of KES.10,000.

Janet learnt about KADET LTD through group members and so she is applying for her third loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD, with which she intends to buy more material like plastic papers,baskets and velvet. The anticipated profits she will use to support the family.

In future Janet wishes to expand her business. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy more material like plastic papers,baskets, velvet.

loans.name: Hindu

texts.en:
Hindu is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Hindu has been selling <i>kikois (a type of sarong) door-to-door for over one year. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Hindu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a boutique shop in the future. With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase 30 pieces of kikois and 20 pairs of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 30 pieces of kikois and 20 pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Resiatu

texts.en:
Resiatu has operated her fruits and vegetables business for the last two years in Naivasha town. 42 years old, she is married to Mainke Ole Risa with two children. 

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to add more stock to serve her increasing customers.

In the future, Resiatu hopes to become the leading supplier of fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To add more stock of fruits & vegetables to serve the increasing customers.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah M. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.

Annah has a business selling charcoal. Annah has requested a loan of 700000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She sells charcoal on a retail basis only. She also generates additional income through a small retail shop.

The main business challenges for Annah include the rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. 

Annah lives in a home that she rents.  She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, food, and medication

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Ishongororo  Twekundire Group-Ibanda

texts.en:
34 years old, T. Jane is a member of Ishongororo Twekundire Group-Ibanda. Jane and her fellow group members decided to take this photo in her shop.

This happily married mother of 3 has run her shop in Ishongororo Town for 9 years. Having started her shop with savings from selling goats, she continues to supplement her income through agriculture. Running the shop and farming both require hard work, dedication, resolve and courage. In that regard Jane has not failed. She earns 50,000 shillings weekly. Jane says with this loan, she is going to purchase more general merchandise for resale.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha J. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother).   

Aisha has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 15 years. She mainly sells on a retail basis.  Aisha has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

The main business challenges for Aisha include the rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to own a delivery van. 

Aisha lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Vive en el municipio de el Torno,  es nacida en el departamento de Chuquisaca, hace uno 10 años que se vino a vivir a la ciudad de santa cruz, su esposo con el cual tiene dos hijos se dedica al  transporte de personas(taxi), en la ciudad de santa cruz, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa en el mercado de la comunidad, hace unos dos años que se dedica a este negocio, viaja a la ciudad de la Paz a comprar mercadería ya que este fin de año se incrementa su venta y desea abastecerse de mercadería, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería por fin de año, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Zonia lives in the town of El Torno.  She was born in Chuquisaca department but 10 years ago she came to live in the city of Santa Cruz.  Her husband, with whom she has two children, is a taxi driver in the city of Santa Cruz.  Zonia's main business activity is selling clothes in her local market.  She has been in this business for two years.  She travels to the city of La Paz to buy merchandise since her sales increase suring the end-of-year season and she would like to stock her business with merchandise.  Her loan will be used to buy merchandise for the end-of-year season.  Zonia is a young and very hard-working person.  She is grateful to our institution for the support she receives.

loans.use: To buy a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over twelve years, he has operated a fish selling business at the market. In addition he has rental houses which contribute to his income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to establish a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000, he wants to purchase two ice boxes to preserve fresh fish for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase 2 ice boxes to preserve fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Tabitha Nzasu

texts.en:
31 years old, Tabitha is married to M., a farmer. She has a run a retail shop for three years to contribute to the family's income, making a profit of Kshs. 7,500 a month. 

This is her third loan from Kadet after successfully repaying the previous ones well and on time. She wants to use it to buy sugar beans, lentils and rice for sale. She hopes to improve this business in order to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy sugar beans, lentils and rice for sale

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia vive  en el municipio de el Torno,  es nacida en el departamento de Chuquisaca, hace unos 20 años que se vino a vivir a la ciudad de santa cruz, su esposo brinda el servicio de taxi en la ciudad de santa  cruz, hace unos 4 años que esta en este rubro, tienen tres hijos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar,  por lo que tienen que trabajar los dos para sostener a su familia ya que sus ingresos a veces no les alcanza, el destino del crédito solicitado es para comprar ropa y asi poder incrementar  el capital de trabajo, ya que por fin de año la demanda de productos es alta y esta época ella puede ahorrase algo de dinero, es una persona muy trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.	.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in the town of El Torno.  She was born in Chuquisaca department but came to live in the city of Santa Cruz twenty years ago.  Her husband provides a taxi service in the city of Santa Cruz.  He has been in this business for 4 years.  Silvia has three young, school-age children.  Both she and her husband have to work to support their family since their incomes sometimes don't stretch far enough.

Silvia will use her loan to buy clothes so that she can increase her working capital.  During the end-of-year season, demand for her products is high which means that she can save a little money.  Silvia is a very hard-working person and she is grateful to our institution for the support she receives.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 47, is married with 4 children aged between 12 and 24. Two of the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where she has been farming for twenty years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize, eggs and beans which she sells locally. She is also a tailor.

She has requested this loan of 51,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income obtained from the sale of milk will enable her expand her existing business and also pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in five years' time, her milk productivity will have increased and prices will have stayed stable as they are at the moment.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, minutas, como empanadas, tortillas, croqueta, asaditos de carne etc. y  otras actividades. 
La  mayoría   son madres de familia y  cabezas de hogar por lo que día a día se sacrifican mucho para salir adelante
 Este comité se encuentra en su 8vo ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en las capacitaciones. 
 Desean que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas por eso se esfuerzan el doble para poder brindar a sus hijos oportunidades de progreso.
Una de las integrantes, una señora muy trabajadora Celina quien se dedica a la recolección y venta de productos que se reciclen como plásticos y papeles. 
Ella hace un recorrido por los barrios diariamente para recolectar las basuras que se pueden reciclar en una carretilla que posee y una vez que cuenta con buena cantidad lo lleva par la venta y así obtiene el ingreso para su familia. 
Ella forma se encuentra muy satisfecha por formar parte del comité y solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías de consumo para su familia como carne, aceite, harina, fideos, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The members of this committee engage in a number of business activities including clothes sales, sales of flavored ice drinks, empanadas, tortillas, croquettes, grilled meat, etc.

Most of the group's members are mothers and heads of their households.  For this reason, they work hard every day to get ahead.

This committee is entering its 8th loan cycle.  Every member has a sense of responsibility and a desire to make progress.  They all attend their training sessions.  They would like to avoid their children having to suffer the same work and educational limitations that they did and so they work doubly hard to provide their children with opportunities for progress.

One of the group's members, a very hard-working lady called Celina, works collecting and selling recyclable products such as plastic and paper.  She passes through neighborhoods daily to collect garbage that can be recycled.  She collects these products in a little cart that she owns and once she has a good quantity, she takes it all to sell and earn income for her family.

Celina is very happy to be a part of her committee and she is requesting a loan to buy food for her family such as meat, oil, flour, noodles, fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy meat, oil, flour, noodles, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima N. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school.  

Halima has a business selling sweet potatoes (food stall). She has been in this business for six years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Halima sells her products at the market by means of retail.  

Halima has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet potatoes. The main business challenges for Halima include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to start growing potatoes herself. 

Halima lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, food, and medication

loans.use: To buy sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith S. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members. 

Edith has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years.  Edith has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through renting rooms. 

The main business challenges for Edith include the rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to own a delivery van. 

Edith lives  in a home that she owns.  She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a deep fried potato selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She also sells coconuts at the market which contributes to her income.  Fatuma faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to supply potatoes wholesale in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, wheat flour, salt, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, wheat flour, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah L. is thirty years old supporting a family of four people. She is married to Jackson Chemase who produces additional income for the family. Her children are 10, 7, and 2 and a half years old.

She runs a retail shop and also does maize farming. She has been in business for four years and right now her monthly income from the business is Ksh 40,000. She is borrowing Ksh 45,000 to use as follows: Ksh 2,500 to buy seeds; Ksh 10,500 to buy fertilizer; Ksh 6000 for ploughing and Ksh 26,000 to pay wages and other expenses. She will reinvest profits from her expanded business into the retail shop and to plant passion fruits. This is her third loan and she paid her previous loans successfully.  Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses in her plot at Tambach town and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds,fertilizer and ploughing

loans.name: Karim Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karim; ella tiene 37 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche,menestras,golosinas entre otros, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su familia. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su pequeño negocio y así poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Karim is a member of the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Karim is 37 years old.  She is separated and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She sells essentials such as rice, sugar, milk, pulses, candy, etc.  She is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead.  She works together with her family.

Karim is requesting this loan to keep her small business running and thereby get her children ahead in life.

She is grateful to those who will take part in this dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To keep her small business running and thereby get her children ahead in life

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Dorcas  Wambui

texts.en:
Dorcas has farmed for two years in Ndunyu Njeru town. She is 51 years old and single. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan funds to buy fertilizers, seedlings and pay for farm labour.

In the future, Dorcas aspires to increase farm production by practicing large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seedlings and pay for farm labour.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El Sr Gilberto vive por el plan 3000 en una casa en anticrético , tiene 2 hijos el Sr Gilberto se dedica al transporte cuenta con un microbús y un derecho de línea  en la cual trabaja y además cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposa que es maestra de colegio el dinero que necesitan es para el arreglo mecánico de su micro (Motor , corona y caja ) y con el tiempo ya poder comprarse una casita propia aunque sea lejano pero propio para tener tranquilidad el y su familia, y así poder brindarles una buena calidad  de vida, es una persona muy trabajador, el dinero del crédito es para el arreglo mecánico de su microbús y así poder trabajar sin ningún problema, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gilberto lives in a rental house in Plan 3000.  He has two children.  Gilberto provides a transport service with his minibus.  He has a license for a route which he works on.  He also receives financial support from his wife who is a school teacher.

Gilberto needs money to fix his minibus (engine, sprocket, gear box).  In the future, he would like to be able to buy a home of his own.  He wouldn't mind if it was far away, but he would like it to be his own so that he and his family could live peacefully and so that he could provide his family with a good quality of life.

Gilberto is a very hard-working person and he will use his loan money to have his minibus repaired so that he can work without problems.  He is very grateful to our institution for the support he receives.

loans.use: To have his minibus repaired

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For over ten years, she has been selling clothes from home. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to sell wholesale in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man and the father of three young children. He started his own business running a car painting shop in 1990. Gradually, he began building a large clientele in need of his services, so he bought a painting machine in order to meet that demand, and over the years, he has done well at managing his business. Each day he looks for things to add that are of value so that his business can become a big shop known by others. 

He is currently requesting his first loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  in order to buy new painting tools. In the not too distant future, he hopes to diversify his business by offering car spare parts. His dreams include seeing his family get ahead and developing his business level.

loans.use: to buy new painting tools

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia N. lives in the Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is divorced and has four children, all of whom are in school.  

Dalia has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for two months, and she works 7 days out of every week. Dalia sells her products at the market by means of retail.    

Dalia has requested for a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Dalia include thieves and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only, and to educate her children up to university. 

Dalia lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
Este comité Mujeres Dinámicas es un comité  que está  en el segundo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya cuenta con 12 integrantes. 
Una de las integrantes y de quien se puede hablar es la Sra. Licia quien posee un pequeño puesto de venta de frutas al costado de la calle de su comunidad, ella va al mercado de abasto a comprar las frutas que posteriormente vende y en ese lugar es más barato que los otros. 
Ella vende además jugos naturales, tiene clientela formadas con el ingreso que ella obtiene día a día ayuda al marido. Ingreso en el comite con la idea de ampliar su pequeño negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas como manzana, naranjas, melones, sandias, piñas y otros.
Es un comité donde las integrantes tienen  muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Dinámicas' (Dynamic Women) committee is in its second loan cycle as part of Fundación Paraguaya's Women's Committee Program.  The group has 12 members.

One of the committee's members, who we will talk about here, is Luisa Arhens.  She owns a small street stall where she sells fruit in her community.  She goes to the market to buy her fruit which she then sells.  It is cheaper here than in other places.  She also sells natural juices.  She has regular customers and she uses her profits to help her husband.  She joined the committee so that she could expand her small business.  She is requesting her loan to buy fruit such as apples, oranges, melons, watermelons, pineapples, etc.

All of the members of this committee have a great desire to improve themselves.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs and water pipes.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Isatu J.. She is married and has 4 children ages 2, 5, 7, and 12 years. In 2003, Isatu established her palm oil and rice business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain herself and her family. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, Isatu earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business.
