She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to add stock to her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 550,000.  In the future, Isatu plans to sell her goods in neighbouring countries in order to increase her profits. She would also like to hire workers. 

Isatu is very hardworking and dedicated, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To increase stock for business

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. lives in the Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  

Teddy has a business selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for fifteen years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Teddy sells her products at the market by means of retail.   Teddy has requested for a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. 

The main business challenges for Teddy include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university. 

Teddy lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with ten children, nine of whom graduated from school, while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a coconut selling business from home for over one year. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario y su esposa la Sra. Graciela llevan muchos años de casados, cuentan con casa propia en la cual  viven con 1 de sus hijos que aun es soltero y estudia y los otros cuatros ya tienen su familia a parte, EL Sr. Mario llego a nuestra oficina por referencia de un compañero de trabajo, Don Mario tiene un vehículo propio del cual tiene un chofer que lo trabaja haciendo servicios transporte urbano el cual le da renta diaria, Doña Graciela tiene una venta de pollo a la Broaster en su mismo domicilio y de esa manera le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, el préstamo solicitado será destinado para el mantenimiento de su vehículo (Chapería en general), "estamos muy agradecidos con su institución ya que depositaron su confianza en nosotros" dijeron.
texts.en:
Mario and his wife Graciela have been married for many years.  They have their own home where they live with one of their children who is still single and studying.  Their other four children already have families of their own.

Mario arrived at our office, having been referred by a work colleague.  Mario has his own vehicle.  A driver works in Mario's vehicle providing urban transport services.  He hires it from him on a daily basis.  Graciela has a business selling Broaster chickens from home.  She helps her husband with their household expenses.

Mario will use his loan to service his vehicle (general bodywork).  “We are very grateful to your institution for placing your trust in us”, they said.

loans.use: To service his vehicle

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.  

Sylvia has a hardware business. She has been in this business for one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sylvia sells her products in a shop by means of retail.   Sylvia has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cement, iron sheets, and nails. 

The main business challenges for Sylvia include the rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only and to build her own house.  Sylvia lives in a home that she rents.  She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy cement, iron sheets, and nails

loans.name: Poline

texts.en:
Poline is a dairy farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. She has been farming for 18 years now and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk to the local market. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of coffee which she sells to the local market.

Poline is 43 years old and a widowed mother of two children aged 17 and 22 who both attend school.

She has requested this loan of 35,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter. The extra income from this loan will help her pay for the education of her children. Her major challenge has been fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce. She hopes that her milk production will increase in the future since she hopes to acquire more dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Hawa K.. She is married and has 5 children ages 4, 6, 7, 9, and 12. She has one additional dependent, a child whom she helps educate. 

In 2003, Hawa established her groundnuts business. She began her business because she wanted to support her family. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to add more stock to her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000. In the future, Hawa plans to sell bags and hire a helper. She is very hardworking and dedicated and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add stock to expand business

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa, D. 55 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor D. 58 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy pequeña, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar con la tierra, motivo por el cual cuando obtuvo su mayoría D. edad, compró sus propios terrenos para trabajarlos ella misma. Actualmente ella siembra cacao, café y hojas D. coca, ya que sabe que son los productos que mejor se están vendiendo actualmente en el mercado, es por eso que pone todo su esfuerzo en que su producción sea D. muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es trabajar en la agricultura, ya que siente que es lo que mejor sabe hacer, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todos los días sin importar las condiciones del clima. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar su crédito puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro en el futuro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, además invertirá parte del dinero en abrir una tienda D. abarrotes, la cual ella misma atenderá.
texts.en:
Felipa is 55 years old.  She is an enterprising and very kind woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband, 58 year-old Víctor, and her 5 beloved children who she wants to offer a better quality of life.

When she was very little, Felipa's parents taught her to work the land.  When she came of age, she bought her own plots of land so that she could work them herself.  She currently grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  Since she knows that these are the products which are currently selling the best in the market, she puts all her effort into producing good quality crops.  What she most likes about her work is farming since she feels that it is what she best knows how to do.  She has been doing this work for 35 years and considers that the most difficult part of her work is having to work every day no matter what the weather is like.  In the future, she would like to buy new land so that she can increase her production.

This is Felipa's first loan with MFP.  She knows that she must make her loan repayments punctually if she would like to have access to another loan in the future and she is ready to do this.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops.  She will also invest part of the money in opening a grocery store which she will serve in herself.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and also to buy essential groceries so that she can open a store

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents).  

Magdalena has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for three months and she works 7 days out of every week. Magdalena sells her products at the market by means of retail.  Magdalena has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  

The main business challenges for Magdalena include the rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to own a delivery van.  

Magdalena lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Baitila

texts.en:
Baitila is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school, while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has been operating a food stall business for the past four years.  She sells from the market to her neighbours and passersby. Baitila faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and establish a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase foodstuff, sugar, wheat flour, rice, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff, sugar, wheat flour, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has been practicing mixed farming for four years in the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. Her farm produces tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes and milk which are sold to the local market. Farming is her main source of income.

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 KES in order to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family. She hopes to expand her farm in the future by acquiring more dairy cows.

Mercy is 28 years-old and married with one child age 2½ years-old.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Reveca

texts.es: Reveca, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los arduos días de trabajo que Reveca tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, junto a la mayor de sus hijas trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos que utiliza para eliminar a las plaga de insectos, pueden afectar su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, siente que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que quiere acceder a otros créditos en el futuro. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Reveca is 34 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her 3 beloved children who are her motivation to work hard.  Reveca works hard on her farm which has enabled her to improve her crops and make her land more productive.  Together with her eldest daughter, she works from very early in the morning, growing cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  These are products which she will later take to sell in the city of San Francisco.  What she most likes about her work is sowing her crops and watching them grow.  She has been in this business for 10 years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be spraying her crops since the chemicals that she uses to get rid of insects can affect her health.  Over time, she hopes to buy more land and thereby expand her production.

This is Reveca's first loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to make her loan repayments punctually and she is ready to do so since she would like to be able to access further loans in the future.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Mari Cruz

texts.es: Mari Cruz C. E.: Tiene 4 Hijos, Mari Cruz Tiene un molino de nixtamal lo atiende todos los dia a parte de eso tiene su restaurante, lo atiende tambien todos los dias, ella tambien vende tortillas todo los dias los tres tiempos cuenta con tres personas que le ayudan a realizar sus actividades todos los dias. Solicita el credito para comprar productos de comestibles, y tambien para comprar un depocito de agua,esta contenta porque sus sueños que tenia para realizar este año se le a cumplido, agradece a Fape por la ayuda brindada y sus sueño para este año es tener otro restaurante.
texts.en: Mari Cruz C. E. has 4 children.  She has a nixtamal mill with which she provides a service every day.  She also has a restaurant in which she works every day and she sells tortillas every day too.  She has three people who help her in her business activities.  She is requesting this loan to buy food products and also a water tank.  She is happy because she has managed to fulfil her dreams for this year.  She is grateful to Fape for the support we have provided.  Her dream for the coming year is to open another restaurant.

loans.use: To buy food products to make meals and to buy a water tank

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “Sembradoras” está iniciando su ciclo Nº13 en el Centro Focal D. Cascada. Cuenta con diez integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Teófila, por la tesorera, la señora Feliza y como secretaria D. actas Soledad. Los negocios D. las señoras están relacionados con el comercio y servicio. 

La señora Teofila, presidenta D. la asociación “Sembradoras”, es socia antigua, ella comentó que solicitó su primer crédito hace once años atrás, después D. un tiempo dejó  D. solicitar el crédito, hasta ahora, que lo necesita y que ha sido invitada por una "comadre" a formar parte D. la banca comunal.  La señora Felisa cuenta con el negocio D. compra venta D. Baterías D. auto, inició el negocio por iniciativa propia, ella compra las baterías usadas D. automóvil y luego las venD. a una fábrica.   Ahora requiere D. crédito para iniciar un nuevo negocio D. costura, ya cuenta con la máquina D. coser, lo que le falta es la tela.  La señora Felisa está casada y es madre D. tres hijos.
Cuando se le consulta sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta D. Pro Mujer, ella responD. con énfasis que le gusta el “ahorro” y que por eso ha vuelto.
texts.en:
The 'Sembradoras' (Sowers) community bank is starting its 13th loan cycle as part of the Cascada regional office.  The bank has ten members.  Its board is maD. up of a president, Teófila, a treasurer, Feliza and a secretary, Soledad.  The ladies' businesses are in commerce and services.

Teófila, president of the 'Sembradoras' community bank, is an old client of Pro Mujer.  She tells us that she requested her first loan eleven years ago.  After a while she stopped requesting loans.  However, she now needs a loan again and has been invited to be a member of the community bank.

Feliza has a business buying and selling car batteries.  She started her business on her own initiative.  She buys used car batteries and then sells them to a factory.  She requires a loan to start up a new sewing business.  She already has a sewing machine but needs fabric.  Feliza is married and has three children.  When we asked her what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replied emphatically “the savings” and this is why she has come back.

loans.use: To buy used batteries and fabric

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo y se encuentra trabajando solidariamente para ir creciendo cada una y también el grupo, y tratan de cumplir con todas las responsabilidades que tienen cada una. 
Se puede mencionar a la Sra. Ana Maria C. con 35 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a hacer su Quiniela por la mañana luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su quiniela.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales precaria. 
De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra los gastos de la casa ya que llega la época de navidad y los ingresos que obtiene no le alcanza para las mejoras que quiere realizar por su vivienda.
texts.en:
This committee is in its third loan cycle.  The members work jointly so that each individual, and the group, can continue to grow.  They try to fulfil all the responsibilities that each member has.

Here we can mention Mrs Ana Maria C..  She is 35 years old and has two children who stay in the house while she goes out in the morning to sell lottery tickets.  She returns home to make their lunch and then goes out again in the afternoon to sell her tickets.

Ana Maria is a long-suffering woman who has a very difficult day every day because when she gets home from work she has to do her housework.  She does everything to get herself and her children ahead in life as she is a single mother.  Ana Maria has a very small, poorly-constructed, house.  She works so that she can cover her home expenses and those of her two children who go to school.  She is requesting this loan so that she can cover home expenses as the Christmas period is approaching and the income she makes from her business doesn't stretch far enough to cover the improvements that she would like to make on her home.

loans.use: Expenses for improving her home

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El Sr. Iván tiene  domicilio  propio que consta de 2 cuartos y cocina, en la cual vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa la Sra. María Isabel. El se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano cuenta con un vehículo propio el cual fue adquirido con su esfuerzo propio, su esposa la Sra. María Isabel apoya también con otro ingreso de confección de prendas de vestir, el mismo que es en su domicilio así de esa forma ayuda con los gastos del hogar, el fin del préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de llantas y otros res puestos para su vehículo, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Iván lives in his own home which has 2 rooms and a kitchen.  He lives with his two children and his wife María Isabel.  Iván provides an urban transport service with his own vehicle which he acquired through his own hard work.  His wife, María Isabel, also helps support the family with the profits she makes from her dressmaking business which is located in their home.  In this way she helps with household expenses.

Iván is requesting this loan to invest in buying tires and other spare parts for his vehicle.  He is grateful to the institution for the support he receives.

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Ablamvi Théophile

texts.fr: Théophile est âgé de 36 ans et est marié. IL a en charge 3 enfants.  Pour arriver à répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, il fait l’activité de taxi moto. Il a débuté cette activité en 2006 et le fait dans les zones environnantes  d’Agbalépédo. A travers cette activité, il avait sollicité plusieurs crédits qui sont déjà remboursés. Il demande un nouveau prêt pour acheter une nouvelle moto pour son activité.
texts.en: Théophile is a married 36 year old with three children in his care. In order to meet their needs he drives a taxi bike for a living; he began working in this field  in 2006 and works in the areas around Agbalépédo. Through this line of work he has already received and repaid several loans.  He is now seeking a  loan in order to buy a new motorbike for his work.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man living with his parents in Lebanon. Despite his young age,  he has proven to be a successful entrepreneur with his computer shop. He has owned and run this shop for two years. He started with his own computer equipment to perform transcriptions and take advantage of the schools nearby.  

Slowly but surely, he began building a large clientele in need of computer services, so he bought more computers in order to meet that demand. Each day he looks for things to add that are of value so that his business can become a big internet café.  He has the potential of gaining more customers since he is located near a school where there is a demand for computer services.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his shop and expand it.   He is positive about his business prospects and plans to further expand.

loans.use: to improve his shop and expand it

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata, de 54 años, vive  junto a su esposo Alejandro de 55 años y sus tres queridos hijos en su casa propia, ella  esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mantener feliz a su familia. Ella vive tranquila laborando en su  chacra, en la cual produce los siguientes productos, como: cacao, café y  plátano. Considera que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que los ingresos que obtiene por sus productos son muy altos  y gracias a ello  puede sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles un mejor futuro. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más terrenos  e incrementar su producción. Honorata viene trabajando en esta actividad hace 30 años y es conocedora  de su labor y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las cosechas, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando frutos, pero considera que lo que menos le agrada son los días de mucha lluvia, porque perjudican su plantaciones. Es su primer crédito con MFP, ella  esta dispuesta  a cancelar puntualmente, porque con el tiempo piensa sacar más financiamiento. Los mil nuevos soles, lo invertirá para contratar operario para que le ayuden a preparar la tierra de su campo agrario antes de la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Honorata is 54 years old.  She lives with her husband, 55 year-old Alejandro, and her three beloved children in her own home.  She is prepared to work very hard to keep her family happy.  She lives a quiet life, working on her farm.  She produces the following crops: cacao, coffee and bananas.  She considers her work to be very profitable since the profits that she makes from her products are very high which has enabled her to get her children ahead and offer them a better future.

Over time, Honorata would like to buy more land and increase her production.  She has been working in this business for 30 years.  She knows her work really well and what she most likes about it are the harvests since she feels that her hard work is paying off.  However, what she most dislikes are really rainy days because the rain threatens her crops.

This is Honorata's first loan with MFP.  She is prepared to make her loan repayments punctually because she is planning to take more loans in the future.  The 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting will be invested in hiring laborers to help her prepare her land before the next sowing season.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help her prepare her land before she sows her crops

loans.name: Joyas Para Cristo 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Lissette is the coordinator of her group Joyas para Cristo 1 & 2  'Jewels for Christ'.  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Lissette is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her beauty salon by buying 3 hair products packs and materials and to rebuild the place. She started around 7 years ago in her living room with just a blower and a brush.  As time passed, she was able to grow and improve her business.  

She and her husband are raising 4 children.  By working hard, they are committed to educate and give them a better live.  This is the reason why she is running a business. She said her most difficult challenge is to raise her children and she enjoys working in everything related to beauty. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy hair products, and to repair place of business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a bigger oven

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Solomon K.. He is married and has 4 children ages 4, 6, 10, and 13. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he helps with his education.  

In 2000, Solomon K. established his essential drugs business. He began his business because he wanted to increase his income and become self-employed. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month. 

Solomon would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more essential drugs for his store. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, Solomon plans to open a larger drug store, open a laboratory, and hire staff. He wants to his educate children to university level and construct a home for his  family. Solomon is hard working and dedicated and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add  more drugs to his pharmacy shop

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school, while three had graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a grocery business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells coconuts, which contributes to her income. Khadija faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to sell wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar, tomatoes, and potatoes for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, sugar, tomatoes and potatoes for food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El Sr. Walter M. recibe en Asunción es soltero y sin hijos. 
Se dedica específicamente a atender su negocio que es un cyber y alquiler de videojuegos, empezó con el negocio en el año 2007, contando con 2 computadoras para alquilar. 
A medida que corría el tiempo y en vista a que su clientela iba aumentando tuvo que ir invirtiendo más en el negocio y comprando mas maquinas. 
Fue así que acudió a nuestra institución y accedió a los créditos. El crédito actual es para la compra de un Televisor color tipo Plasma de 32”.
Vale la pena destacar que ha crecido mucho comercialmente, con ayuda de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Walter M. lives in Asunción.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  He works in his business which is an Internet café and videogame rental store.  He set up his business in 2007 with two computers that he rented out.

Over time, and seeing that his customer base was increasing, he had to invest more in his business and buy more machines.  This is why he came to our institution and got access to loans.  His current loan will be used to buy a 32” Plasma color television.

We must point out that Walter has grown a lot as a businessman with Fundación Paraguaya's help.

loans.use: To buy a plasma TV

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
K. Deborah lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren).    

Deborah has a business selling fish.  She has been in this business for a few years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Deborah sells her products from home by means of retail.

Deborah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fish.  The main business challenges for Deborah include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only and to educate her children up to university.   

Deborah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills, and food.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila, de 61 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 6 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El negocio al que se dedica Teofila, es el cultivo de hojas de coca, café y cacao, productos que con mucho esfuerzo y paciencia ha logrado cosechar, sus tierras son de las mejores cuidadas de su pueblo, ya que ella es muy responsable con sus cultivos, puesto que sabe que la ganancia que obtenga dependerá de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos ya que los sacos de cultivos son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas crediticios gracias a ello. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Teofila is 61 years old.  She is a woman who has always worked hard to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own home with her 6 beloved children and what she most desires is to enjoy a peaceful old age.  Teofila's business is growing coca leaf, coffee and cacao.  These are products which she has managed to harvest through a lot of effort and patience.  Her land is some of the best looked after in her village since she is very responsible with her crops as she knows that the profits she makes will depend on the quality of her produce.

What Teofila most likes about her work is sowing her land and she does this with a great deal of care.  She has been in this business for 40 years and she considers the most difficult aspect of her work to be transporting her produce since the sacks of crops are very heavy.  In the future, she hopes to buy new land so that she can increase her production.

This is Teofila's first loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual in her payments and has never had any credit problems thanks to this fact.  She will use her 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy more manure to fertilize her crops with.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a Kikoi selling business for the past six years.  She sells from door to door to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she has real estate houses which contribute to her income.  

Sada faces a major challenge of seasonality. During wedding ceremonies, the business does well and she gets lots of customers. She hopes to establish a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 10 pieces of cloth materials, 30 Kikois, and 10 head scarves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials, Kikois, and head scarves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand assorted breads business

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
K. Constance lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

Constance has a business selling soft  drinks. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Constance sells her products in a shop by means of retail.    

Constance has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda, mineral water, and passion fruits. She also generates additional income through her rentals.

The main business challenges for Constance include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to open up more drinking shops within Kamwokya.   

Constance lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy soda, mineral water, and passion fruits

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has been in the farming business for the last ten years. His mixed farm, which is located in Kitale town, western Kenya, produces milk and eggs which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenge has been diseases and difficulties in transporting his products to the local market. 

He has requested this loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that his milk production will improve and that his family will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will enable him to take his children to better schools. In the future, he would like to improve his milk production and be the major supplier of milk to the local market.

Samwel is 46 years-old and married with five children who are between the ages of two and 19. Four of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past twelve years, he has operated a goat trading business.  He buys and sell goats retail from home. His potential customers are neighbors and butcher operators.  George faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors who purchase on credit. He hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the KShs 20,000, he wants to purchase goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Jacqueline Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jacqueline de 32 años,  es una mujer trabajadora y que ha dado mucho esfuerzo para poder mantener a sus dos hijos desde que su esposo la abandono. Para poder sostener su hogar comenzó a vender diferentes artículos a sus vecinos pero como no le generaba el dinero que quería tuvo que retirarse de esa actividad e invertir sus últimos ahorros en víveres para el hogar.   

Ubico la tienda en la parte delantera de su casa donde era la sala y comenzó a vender su primeros víveres, trabajando desde las 06h30am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Durante estos años ha podido surtir la pequeña tienda con varios víveres como arroz, enlatados, granos etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene  para atender en la noche su tienda es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive ya que es una de las zonas más peligrosas de la Perimetral.

Ella quiere seguir incrementando su tienda para darle un buen futuro a sus hijos por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo  arroz, enlatados, bebidas, dulces. En el futuro quiere surtir mas el lugar y tener la oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 32 years old, is a hard-working woman who has devoted much effort to be able to maintain her 2 children since her husband abandoned her.  To sustain her home, she began selling different articles to her neighbors, but this didn't generate the money she needed and she had to abandon this activity and invest her last saving in groceries for her home.

Then she opened a store in the back part of her house where the living room was and she began selling primary necessities, working from 6:30am until 11:00pm every day.  Over these years she has been able to supply her little store with various basics, such as rice, canned goods, grains, etc.  One of the complications has been to attend the store at night due to delinquents in the area where she lives, one of the most dangerous zones of the area surrounding the city.

Jacqueline wants to expand her store to provide a better future for her children.  For this reason, she wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned goods, drinks, and sweets.  In the future, she wants to expand the store and to have the opportunity to study in the university.

loans.use: TO BUY RICE, CANNED GOODS, DRINKS, AND SWEETS FOR HER STORE

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a firewood selling business for the past two years, selling retail from home to her neighbors. In addition, she has real estate houses which contribute to her income. Neema faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in the market. She hopes to expand and educate her children to the higher levels. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for resale

loans.name: Joyas Para Cristo 3, 4 Group

texts.en:
Tania is one of the members of this entrepreneurs group Joyas para Cristo 3 & 4  'Jewels for Christ'.  She is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She sells jewelry, especially silver.   Her plans are to use this loan to invest in bracelets, necklaces, and rings. 

Tania´s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general – many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.  Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She is a single mom of 2 children, living with her parents.  She said her most difficult challenges are to raise her children and to work on her university career, since it hasn´t been possible to find a job.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a member of Enjoro Group in Kitale town, western Kenya which is being funded by Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo. She has been farming for eight years. Her farm produces milk, tomatoes and onions which she sells locally.

Zipporah is 45 years-old and married with six children who are between the ages of 7 and 25. Four of the children are currently attending school.

She recently repaid her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 KES and has requested this loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family. She faces the challenge of transportation of her products to the market. She plans to acquire at least three quality dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. lives in the Mengo kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters and brother). Joyce lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills. 

Joyce owns and operates a beauty salon. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. She sells her products at retail prices in her shop. She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
N. Beatrice lives in the Kasaato Zone of the Mengo Kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of a grandchild.  Beatrice runs a kiosk.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Beatrice sells her products at retail prices.

Beatrice has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda and mineral water, bread, cakes and doughnuts. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Beatrice include seasonality and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked kiosk and pay school fees.  She lives in a home that she owns and where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and mineral water, bread, cakes and doughnuts to resell

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated an ice block selling business for the past three years. She sells from home and from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Sharon faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the winter rainy season, the demand for ice is low compared to the hot summer season when the demand is high. She hopes to expand and establish a boutique.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase a cooler box. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a cooler box.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman with two children, both of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the purchase of food.

She has established a nursery school for young children and has been in operation for the past two years. Her potential customers are the neighboring school children. Jane faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her school in the future. 

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase furniture fittings (chairs, tables and a black chalk board) for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture fittings(chairs, tables and black chalk board) for the school.

loans.name: Mouïmatou

texts.fr: Elle est âgée de 40 ans et  a 2 enfants. Elle  est née à Lomé et habite à Agoè. Elle est couturière de profession mais associe la vente d’article de mercerie. Elle a commencé depuis 1995  et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend ensuite les articles dans son atelier à son domicile. Elle sollicite un prêt pour accroitre son commerce.
texts.en: This lady is 40 years old and has two children in her care. She was born in Lomé and now lives in Agoè. She is a seamstress by trade and sells haberdashery products. She started working in this field in 1995 and sources her goods from the large market in Lomé. She then sells these goods  from her studio at home and is seeking a loan in order to grow her business.

loans.use: Purchasing haberdashery products

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
N. Alice lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has six children, all of whom are in school. Alice now operates a retail shop, having changed her business enterprise from a food stall.  She has been in this business for more than a few months, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products from home at retail prices. 

Alice has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Alice include seasonality and transportation.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to open a wholesale shop and also educate her children up to university level. Alice lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Amina K.. She is married and has three children, ages five, nine and twelve. In 2000, Amina established her foods business where she sells salt and maggi (a seasoning for soups and stews). She began her business because she wanted to be employed and generate income. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about $145 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add additional stock to increase profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. In the future, Amina plans to sell food in bulk. She also hopes to travel internationally to purchase different types of stock and to hire workers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more stock to her business

loans.name: Gerardina

texts.es:
Doña Gerardina, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, tiene 62 años de edad, vive sola, y de dedica a la venta de pescado y camarones, este negocio es movible ya que ella se traslada a pueblos cercanos a vender, este producto le es proveído por un vecino que es pescador.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos y para la reparación de un freezer que le sirve para conservar el pescado congelado y que dure más tiempo,  con este préstamo lograra doña Gerardina tener a disposición de los clientes pescado y camarones frescos y con la reparación de este electrodoméstico podrá almacenar sus productos sin temor a que se le dañen.
Su objetivo es seguir trabajando ya que es su entretención y además es su ingreso para cubrir las necesidades y tener la alimentación necesaria.
texts.en: Gerardina lives in San Miguel located in the department of San Miguel. She is 62 years old and lives by herself. She sells fish and shrimp. This business is mobile since she can travel to nearby towns to sell. She procures her product from a neighbor who is a fisherman. She is requesting a loan to buy seafood and to repair a freezer that she uses to freeze the fish so that it will last longer. This loan will allow Gerardina to be able to provide to her customers fresh fish and shrimp. With the repair of her freezer she will be able to store her products without fear that they will go bad. Her goal is to keep working since this keeps her busy and it also provides income to cover her necessities and allows her to have the necessary food.

loans.use: Purchase seafood and repair a freezer.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO PROGRESO DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispincanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leonarda; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 7 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de salchipapas (plato a base de salchichas y papas fritas) y también trabaja en la región en el área de limpieza desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,la socia vende salchipapas en el mercado de Andahuaylillas y también tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz y luego lo vende en los diferentes mercados, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de salchipapas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como papas y salchipapas.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de artesanía, tienda de abarrotes, venta de frutas, venta de pasto y venta salchipapas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.


En la foto hay una socia que esta en la represetancion de su esposo el socio Giller,la socia es la tercera de la mano izquierda y una socia que esta en el foto que ya no pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas que es la segunda socia de la mano derecha.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas". This bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district which belongs to the Quispincanchis province and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Leonarda. She is 39 years old, has a live-in partner and has seven children. She sells salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dogs) and also works cleaning from 7:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. She sells salchipapas at the Andahuaylillas market. She also has a small plot of land where she grows corn and then sells it at the different markets. The member wants to expand her business selling salchipapas. She is requesting this loan to buy products such as potatoes and salchipapas. 

The other members sell crafts, groceries, fruits, feed and salchipapas. 

The member thanks those people that are part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments in the time established. 

In the photograph there is a member that is there representing her husband, Giller. She is the third member from the left. The second member from the right is no longer a member of the community bank Nuevo Progreso de Andahuaylillas.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes and salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dogs).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase shorts, shirts and beach balls.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
N. Norah lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. Norah has a business of selling fried chips. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days a week. Norah sells her products at the market at retail prices.   

Norah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Norah include seasonality and the ever-increasing price of Irish potatoes.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and educate her children up to the university level.   

She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan K. owns a grocery shop in Makeni city. He wants a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to enable him improve on his business size and quality. With this loan he will be able to buy cans of powdered milk, mayonnaise, butter, cheese, sugar, etc. at wholesale prices. This will eventually lead to more sales and improve profit. Alhassan will thus be able to take better care of his family.

Alhassan was born in Makeni city. He is now twenty-eight years of age. His wife is a businesswoman, too, and their only child is attending primary school. He has been in this business for five years now.

loans.use: Buys cans of powdered milk, mayonnaise, butter, cheese, sugar, etc. at wholesale prices

loans.name: Marta Rubidia

texts.es:
La señora Marta, tiene 53 años de edad, es muy dinámica y trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, reside en Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután donde vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 19 años de edad, este negocio inicio hace dos años, anteriormente se había dedicado a la venta de pólvora.
Actualmente necesita comprar ropa aprovechando la fiesta de fin de año, por lo que solicita un préstamo para aumentar el inventario comprando prendas de vestir con lo último en la moda, ya que así  llamara la atención de más clientela.
Su Objetivo es aumentar el negocio, tener muchas prendas de vestir para dar gusto a los clientes y mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Marta is 53 years old.  She is a very dynamic and hard-working woman.  She sells new clothes and lives in Puerto el Triunfo, in Usulután department, with her husband and 19 year-old son.  She started this business two years ago.  She used to sell fireworks.

Marta currently needs to buy clothes, taking advantage of the end-of-year holiday period.  She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory, buying the very latest fashionable clothes so that she can attract more customers.

Marta's goal is to increase her business, to have many clothes which will please her customers and to improve her family income.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Fatmata D.. She is married and has two children, ages two and six. In 1990, Fatmata established her used clothing business where she sells trousers and shirts. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to help her husband. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about $97 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add stock to her business to increase her profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. In the future, Fatmata plans to sell clothing in bulk and wants to travel internationally to buy additional items for her store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to add more stock of used clothing

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
N. Rose lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.   Rose has a business of a selling second hand clothes She has been in this business for two years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rose sells her products in a shop, at retail prices.  Rose has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms .

The main business challenge(s) for Rose include seasonality and ever increasing prices of  second  hand clothes . Her goals and aspirations for her business are  to start importing second hand clothes and also to educate her children up to university. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and food

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, una señora trabajadora D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y un nieto, ella se dedica a la venta D. mariscos, tiene ya 17 años D. dedicarse a esta actividad, este negocio lo aprendió desD. niña pues se creció en una isla cercana a Jiquilisco.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mariscos ya que desea tener más producto a disposición D. los clientes ya que en este tiempo D. navidad las ventas tienden a aumentar, con esta ayuda podrá ofrece variedad D. mariscos frescos y tendrá la oportunidad D. ver que sus ventas aumenten y recibir mejores ingresos.
Las aspiraciones D. ella, es aumentar sus ventas, para poder ayudar a su familia con mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working, 57 year-old lady.  She lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department, with her husband and a grandchild.  Her business is selling seafood.  She has been in this business for 17 years now.  She learned the business as a young girl because she grew up on an island near Jiquilisco.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy seafood since she would like to have more available for her customers as her sales tend to increase over the Christmas period.  With this help, she will be able to offer a variety of fresh seafood and she will have the opportunity to see her sales increase and to make more income.

Rosa's aspiration is to increase her sales so that she can help her family by providing more income.

loans.use: To buy seafood

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REYNA DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella tiene 45 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio D. venta D. cebiche los días sábados y domingos, la socia venD. D. forma ambulatoria, a la vez la socia tiene un kiosco escolar en el colegio Santa Rosa D. América el cual trabaja D. lunes a viernes por las mañanas.la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y con ganas D. salir adelante. 
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra  D. productos como galletas, dulces, chocolates entre otros, e insumos para su cevichería.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. calzados, venta D. cds, crianza D. pollos, artesanía entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people belong to the “Reyna del Carmen” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Cristina is 45 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has four children.  Her business is selling 'ceviche' (raw fish marinated in lemon and garlic) on Saturdays and Sundays.  She makes her sales as a street trader.  She also has a kiosk in Santa Rosa D. América school where she works from Monday to Friday in the mornings.  She is a very enterprising person who has a great desire to get ahead.

Cristina is requesting this loan to buy products such as cookies, sweets, chocolates, etc. and to buy supplies for her 'cevicheria'.

The other members of the group have businesses which incluD.: selling shoes, selling CDs, raising chickens and making handicrafts.

Cristina is grateful to those who will take part in this dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy products such as cookies, sweets, chocolates etc.  To buy supplies for her 'cevicheria'

loans.name: Dina Argelia

texts.es:
La señora Dina, es emprendedora y laboriosa, tiene 67 años D. edad, posee una ferretería, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera,  departamento D. Morazán, donD. vive con su hijo llamado  Anner D. 29 años D. edad, este negocio lo atienD. en su casa D. habitación durante la semana y el domingo se traslada al mercado municipal, donD. ofrece los artículos.
Ella quiere invertir al negocio, comprando clavos, niveles, sierras, entre otras herramientas, pero su inconveniente es que no tiene los fondos para realizar la compra por lo que solicita un préstamo, y a través D. este conseguir la mercadería para fortalecer el negocio,  contando con variedad para una mejor atención a los clientes.
Su objetivo es que su negocio crezca, progrese y le D. ingresos estables por un largo tiempo.
texts.en:
Dina is an enterprising and hard-working woman.  She is 67 years old and owns a hardware store.  She lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department, together with her son Anner who is 29 years old.  Dina locates her business in her own home during the week and on Sundays she moves it to the town market where she sells her products.

Dina would like to invest in her business, buying nails, spirit levels, saws and other tools.  The problem she has is that she doesn't have enough funds to make these purchases.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will use to acquire the merchandise.  This will strengthen her business as she will have a greater variety of products with which she can better serve her customers.

Dina's goal is to grow her business, to make progress in her business and for her business to proviD. her with a stable income for a long time.

loans.use: To buy nails, spirit levels, saws and other tools

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Here is Osman K., a small scale businessman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Osman sells palm oil, salt, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), sugar, etc. With a loan of SLL 3,000,000, he will buy sugar, palm oil, salt, onions, margi, etc in large quantity to add to his business stock. 

Osman was born in Makeni. The forty-year-old is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children; three in secondary school and one in primary school. Osman has been a businessman for twenty-one years now.

loans.use: To buys sugar, palm oil, salt, onions, margi, etc in large quantity to add to his business stock

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Pictured here is Usman S.. The forty-one-year-old was born in Port Loko, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Usman has four children who are attending primary school. His wife is a businesswoman. For eighteen years now, Usman has been selling onions, tomatoes, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), vegetable oil, etc.  

Usman is seeking for a loan of SLL 5,000,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand his business. With this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his existing stock.

loans.use: To buys onions, tomatoes, margi, vegetable oil, etc. at wholesale to add to his existing stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Fatmata J.. She is married and has 7 children ages 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 15 and 18 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her. She helps to educate them while they help with her business. In 1990, Fatmata established her ready-made bags business. She began her business because she wanted to generate additional income to help her husband. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, Fatama earns about 700,000 Le  every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 Le. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to add additional stock to increase profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 475000 Le. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to sells bags in bulk. She wants to travel internationally to purchase modern bags to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more bags to her business inventory

loans.name: Rubidia Noemi

texts.es:
Rubidia, resiD. en el Mozote, perteneciente al municipio D. Meanguera, departamento D. Morazán, tiene 31 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. artesanía, ella está casada y vive al lado D. su esposo y su primer hija D. tres años D. edad,  Rubidia tiene 8 años D. dedicarse a la venta D. artesanías, pertenece a una cooperativa D. ocho mujeres que venden artesanía turnándose los días D. ventas en kioscos donD. llegan turistas, ella atienD. los miércoles, jueves y domingos, cada artesana tiene su propia mercadería pero existe un horario donD. se turnan para vender a los visitantes que llegan al monumento D. la masacre en el Mozote lugar que es mencionado a nivel nacional e internacional.
Rubidia tiene el negocio bien establecido ya que por el sector al que se dedica y el lugar D. ubicación son propicios para ser reconocida por clientes y contar con trabajo para el sostenimiento D. su hogar; ella ha empezado junto a su esposo el proyecto D. construir su casa y para ello solicita un préstamo que le servirá para comprar D. material D. construcción como bloques y madera, con esta oportunidad del préstamo podrá contar con una casa digna mejorando así las condiciones D. vida D. su familia y al mismo tiempo independizarse D. sus padres con los que actualmente vive.
Su mayor objetivo es construir su casa, realizar una buena inversión con el préstamo, y seguir trabajando por el desarrollo D. su familia.
texts.en:
Rubidia lives in Mozote, in the town of Meanguera, in Morazán department.  She is 31 years old and sells handicrafts.  She is married and lives with her husband and 3 year-old daughter.  Rubidia has been selling handicrafts for 8 years.  She belongs to a cooperative of 8 women who all sell handicrafts.  They take turns to work in kiosks, serving tourists.  Rubidia works Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays.  Each craftswoman has her own merchandise but there is a timetable and they take turns selling to the people who come to visit the monument to the El Mozote Massacre which is known both nationally and internationally.

Rubidia has a well-established business since her business and its location are favorable to her becoming recognized by her customers and having work which will support her household.  Rubidia and her husband have started a project to build their own home and, for this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy building materials such as blocks and wood.  With the opportunity provided by this loan, she will be able to have a decent house and improve the living conditions of her family.  At the same time, she will be able to become independent of her parents who she currently lives with.  Rubidia's biggest goal is to build her house, make a good investment with her loan, and continue working for her family.

loans.use: To buy blocks and wood

loans.name: Duo Solidario Luz Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Duo Solidario
LUZ DEL SOL

MARIA ESTELA P. U..
ella tiene 34 años de edad tiene a sus hijos pequeños, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas, su venta lo realiza ambulante, no tiene ningun puesto ella sale a las casas a vender su producto, su credito lo necesita para comprar mas producto en joyas porque en esta epoca hay venta por esa razon  necesita su dinero.

ALEJANDRO P. C.
Es originario de Chimaltenango, tiene 61 años de edad tiene tres hijos a su cargo, el se dedica a la crianza de vacas, actualmente tiene una vaca lechera, y su prestamo lo necesita para poder comprar otras vacas porque la que tiene atualmente tiene su chiva el quiere obtener otros vacas para criarlas. Y poder obtener mas leche y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
“Duo Solidario” (Supportive Duo)

María Estela Parir Usin is 34 years old, and she has small children.  She sells jewelry in an itinerant manner.  She does not have a stand for sales; she goes to the houses to sell her products.  She needs the loan to buy more jewelry products because there are sales this season.   

Alejandro P. C. is from Chimaltenango.  He is 61 years old and has three children under his care.  He raises cows.  He currently has a dairy cow, and he needs the loan to be able to buy other cows. The cow that he has now has a calf, and he wants to get other cows to raise.  He wants to be able to get more milk and have more income.

loans.use: To buy cows and jewelry

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
M. Margret lives in the Nabweru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Margret has a business of selling used clothes.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Margret sells her products at the market at retail prices.    

Margret has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes.  The main business challenges for Margret include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business.   

She lives in a home that she owns, but where she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Emmanuel S.

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Emmanuel S. K.. He is single and has one child, age five. He has four additional dependents who live with him because they assist with his business and he helps to educate them. 

In 2003, Emmanuel established his assorted drinks business because he wanted to support himself and his family. Working seven days a week and fourteen hours a day, he earns about $163 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to expand his business and allow him to maximize his profit. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 375,000 SLL. 

In the future, Emmanuel plans to educate his child and other dependents to the university level and build a larger shop. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to add more assorted drinks to his kiosk

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Marie K.. She is married and has one child who is four years old. In 2000, Marie established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to support her family. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about $140 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add more stock to her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 295,000 SLL. In the future, Marie plans to educate her children and open a wholesale shop. She would also like to help  her husband provide for the family and keep up her home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: purchase additional items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rudi Manuel

texts.es:
Rudi, es un comerciante de ropa, tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su madre, su esposa y su pequeña hija de dos meses, tiene casa propia ubicada en Jocoaitique departamento de Morazán,  el junto a su esposa venden ropa, además Rudi realiza trabajos de albañilería, este negocio lo tienen ubicado en el mercado municipal de Jocoaitique, lo atienden todos los días de la semana.
El inconveniente que se le presenta a Rudi es por la falta de fondos ya que el comercio de ropa es un sector de frecuente innovación y actualización por las modas, colores y estilos, donde el comerciante se ve obligado a estar pendiente de lo último en el mercado para invertir y ofrecer a los clientes, esta situación le lleva a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercadería ya que en este mes es donde más se busca ropa y él quiere estar preparado para atender la demanda por parte de los clientes. Con esta ayuda podrá surtir el inventario, mejorar sus ventas y la oportunidad de generar para su hogar mejores ingresos.
Sueña con poseer un bazar, con una variedad amplia; en torno a su familia suministrar todo lo necesario para su alimentación y desarrollo y que su hija crezca de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Rudi, age 30, sells clothes.  He lives with his mother, his wife, and his little two month old daughter.  He has his own house, which is located in Jocoaitique in the Morazán department.  He and his wife sell clothes together.  Rudi also does bricklaying jobs.  This business is located in the Jocoaitique municipal market.  He works there every day of the week.

The problem that Rudi has is the lack of funds.  Selling clothes is a field of frequent innovation and changes in fashion, colors, and styles.  The merchant is obliged to be up on the latest in the market in order to invest and offer the latest to the customers.  

This situation brings him to request a loan to buy merchandise.  This is the month when people want more clothes.  He wants to be prepared to take care of the customer demand.  With this help he will be able to stock his inventory, improve his sales, and have the opportunity to generate better income for his household.

He dreams of having a bazaar with a wide variety of merchandise.  Regarding his family, he dreams of supplying them with all that they need to eat and to progress.  He dreams of his daughter growing up in a better way.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en:
This is 21-year-old Adamsay K.. She is married and has two children ages two and five. In 2003, Adamsay established her assorted pans and plastics business. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about $169 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add stock to her business to increase her profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 600,000 SLL. In the future, Adamsay plans to sells items in bulk. She wants to travel internationally to purchase more stock and would like to hire additional workers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina N. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira   neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Amina has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Amina sells her charcoal at the market, wholesale and retail.    Amina has requested  a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through selling tomatoes.

The main business challenges for Amina include transportation and seasonality .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are selling on wholesale only and also buying a plot of land.   Amina  lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Ruth has a business selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for six years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Ruth sells her products at the market, retail.  Ruth has requested a loan of 200,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. 

The main business challenges for Ruth include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second-hand clothes and also to sell wholesale only. Ruth lives in a home that she rents, and she doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Jey Rolando

texts.es: Jey Rolando tiene 29 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de soldadura. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, en donde elabora portones, puertas de hierro, verjas, soldaduras entre otras cosas. Tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad a su cargo pues se preocupa por proporcionarle lo necesario. El motivo del financiamiento es que la demanda se ha incrementado por lo que su capital es poco y tiene que comprar herramientas, protectores, soldador con cable. Sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio y además sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jey Rolando, age 29, provides soldering services in his shop.  He has had this business for over ten years.  He makes large doors, iron doors, gates, and soldering, among other things.  He has a two year old child under his care, and Jey Rolando worries about giving him the necessities.

The reason for the loan is that demand has increased, and he has little capital.  He has to buy tools, shields, and a soldering-iron with cable.

He dreams of getting ahead with his business and of getting his child ahead.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 58 year old Abu T.. He is married and has three children ages 4, 12 and 20. In 1980, Abu established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to generate income and continue to improve the living conditions of his family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 300000 SLL every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of  3000000 SLL in order to buy more stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250000 SLL. 

In the future, Abu plans to expand his business. He would also like build a house for his family and continue to educate his children to university level. Abu finds it challenging to meet the high cost of living and transportation in Makeni, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used clothing for her business

loans.name: Carmen Alexandra

texts.es:
Carmen de 38 años, hace un año atrás se separo de su esposo y ella tuvo que comenzar a conseguir dinero para poder mantener a sus tres hijos de 12, 8 y 2 años de edad. Inicio con las  ventas productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes por catalogo). 

Por la buena administración que le ha dado a su capital de trabajo ahora es conocida por el sector donde vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. Hace por semana pedidos para que les lleguen los productos que les piden sus clientes y los vende a un bajo costo. Trabaja desde las 08h00am visitando a sus conocidos y clientes fieles para que compren los productos. 

Ella quiere seguir trabajando surtiendo su mercadería comprando con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, tratamientos. En el futuro quiere tener un local para ofrecer sus productos y surtir su mercadería vendiendo ropa.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old.  One year ago she separated from her husband and had to start making money so that she could support her three children aged 12, 8 and 2.
